reviews.review_body:
Perfect watch!
My husband is happy to use them everyday. Looks brutal ;)

First of all let me tell you this is better than anything Martian has ever offered as far as looks and overall stylishness. That's where it ends if falls back on martians old old old technology there are so many dead ends with his technology guess probably just wanted to get a smart device in the marketplace.  I can recommend it on its looks I can't recommend it on its technology.  Can you say old school
Love my watch. Get compliments all the time.
Cannot get firmware upgraded. Tried 2 different computers.  Pissed off!!!
Didn't work right
Won't stay connected...tried with different phones

Beautiful watch.  People don’t realize it’s a smart watch.  BuT only for notifications. It’s limited but elegant. Stylish.

Update: less than 3 months after I purchased the watch , the battery died. When we carefully went to take the battery out, the back of the watch which is plastic, snapped. We contacted amazon support however it was past the time in which we could be assisted by Amazon. They did reach out on our behalf to the seller. When we did speak with the distributor, we were given an address to mail the item back for repairs.  We have to pay for the shipping back and forth. For a$200 watch to be broken less than 90 days after purchase is extremely disappointing.
Best smartwatch that look like a luxury watch notification is really good even under the sun you can read the notification.

The dial is too busy but more importantly, the Martian notifier is annoying with the phone answering function because it answers the call by default when you just want to use your phone instead. This is especially annoying when the watch is somewhere else in the house and is connected. The product description doesn't say it uses the Martian notifier. Had I known that, I wouldn't have ordered this watch because I had a Martian watch which was fine for a few months then suddenly the notifier stopped working.

All caps because you need to know this! TO USE ALEXA YOU DOWNLOAD THE GUESS APP TO YOUR PHONE AND ENABLE ALEXA. EASY. CHARGE THE PHONE, IT WAS DEAD WHEN I GOT MINE, TAKES 2 HOURS. YOU PUSH THE BOTTOM BUTTON FOR 2 SECONDS TO POWER ON THE WATCH. PAIR IT WITH YOUR PHONE( Bluetooth on ok). EASY. NOW THE PART NOT IN THE INSTRUCTIONS ANYWHERE. PLEASE READ:

QUICK PRESS OF TOP BUTTON ON RH SIDE OF THE WATCH AND YOU GET GOOGLE ASSISTANT NOT ALEXA. I LOOKED EVERYWHERE AND COULD NOT GET ALEXA  TO ANSWER. HERES THE TRICK, HOLD THE TOP BUTTON DOWN! BOOM ALEXA IS THERE. WOW THAT NEEDS ADDED TO THE MANUAL. WATCH IS GREAT, MANUAL SUCKS.

Its great. It has a lot of cool features without looking like a TV strapped to your wrist. Looks like a large watch, a nice large watch that is a little heavy but not too bad. I would recommend this product.

Cons: can't play music from Amazon. Seems limited a bit. It would be nice if I could get it to talk to my Dot and Fire TV. I'm still looking to see if that's possible. I just got the watch so if I figure that out I will add it to this review later. I want a real help section, the basics are there but my God you don't even show us how to talk to Alexa, the reason we bought this model of smart watch. That's kinda stupid.

This watch does a lot more than it says so poke around and try things. It's a quality piece. I can't understand why people build all these features into smart phones and watches and never tell anyone. Why would ya do that? Anyway yep buy this if you want an Alexa watch. The speaker is tiny so she sounds a little muffled but you can hear her just fine.

We finally have a real Dick Tracy watch! Enjoy.

Edit: I found the real owners manual. Go to the Guess app on your phone. Settings-Help and Support-Owners Manual. There is the real manual. There should have been a printed copy of that included in the box, thats too hard to find. There is a lot of good info there though.
Too big for my taste. It worked fine and looked good but I had to return it
I liked the watch and even wrote a blog about it. Unfortunately it broke after a month and a half of use. Just won't power on.
it's good

I really want to love this watch.  The main reason I purchased it was because of the Alexa compatibility.  Bottom line, the watch is nice.  I can make calls relatively easily and send and receive texts.  I have not been able to get Alexa working and the Guess app is ridiculous.  There are no back button capabilities so I have to keep getting out of it and going back in.  The Guess website is basically no help.  It told me to get new firmware for the watch. Really????  I just took it out of the box today!!  So I did that.  I then restarted my phone.  Then restarted the watch.  Nothing.  No "Alexa Tab" as the FAQ's Alexa section told me I should see.  I sent an e-mail to the Guess Connect support people.  We shall see where it goes.  Bottom line...If Alexa is not part of this, I will return it.  I guess I am used to Amazon products.  I have purchased the Kindle Fire, Echo, Tap, Dot, Fire TV and yes...I even have a Fire Phone.  I have never had this much of an issue setting up any of the aforementioned  products.
More to come if I hear back from anyone.
UPDATE!! 1-18-17- Never received an e-mail or call from the Guess people.  Called Amazon and spoke to Hunter.  He was great.  He got me a number for the Guess people.  I called and pressed all the appropriate numbers only to be disconnected almost immediately.  I called back.  Spoke to Stephanie.  She could not help but transferred gave me a number of someone who could.  Called that number.  Pressed all the appropriate numbers and was quickly disconnected.  Called back and spoke to a man who did not give his name.  I explained I could not connect the watch to Alexa and that was the main reason I purchased the watch.  Was asked what type of phone I had.  I replied android.  He then told me to check the Guess Connect APP version I had downloaded.  I went to the app and told him v2.0.3.  He said that was the problem.  Alexa will not work without v2.0.5.  I explained that was not an option ion the google play app store.  And furthermore, the app store states that v2.0.3 was released last Wednesday, 1/11/17 and it specifically addresses Alexa.  He said no, I need v2.0.5.  Ok, I replied.  How can I get this.  He stated he would look into it and call me tomorrow.  More to come.
**Final Update** 2-2-17- I will keep this brief.  My Fire phone is not capable of downloading the Guess Connect App in it's entirety.  The Alexa piece would not come through.  I contacted Amazon at least 9 times and unfortunately I could not get anybody to help.  The Fire Phone is no longer supported.  I purchased a new cell phone, under duress, and the app came through perfectly.  The watch now has Alexa capabilities and I would like to change my review of the watch to 5 stars.  It works like a dream.  Texting, calls, and Alexa work perfectly.

reviews.review_body: Dead on arrival. DON'T BUY
Do not buy this watch.
Trash it don’t work

Doesn’t work … does not turn on.
Bought two, returned two.
Battery in watch Dead on arrival. When I replaced with new battery the mode button was erratic. The start-stop button was intermittent. The next button was intermitted.
Battery was dead upon arrival of package. Had to buy a new one.

Watch was dead on arrival the 4 screws that hold the back on are very small takes a screwdriver made for glasses to take off the back. I am getting ready to buy a new battery and send pyle the cost, even though it is of very little cost it is the idea of working on a new product that should work out of the box. I wont buy anything from pyle.  D Jackson

I bought this watch as a gift for my son because it had a pedometer and a timer, not an easy combination to find.  I didn't realize this when I bought it, but the wristband is not actually connected to the watch, it's just a holding band, like fitbit bands are.  It falls out sometimes and freaks my son out, because he's afraid of losing it.
I received the watch with a dead battery. Don't know if the watch even works. Like who wants to purchase any item and received it not working??? These situations are really upsetting
didn't work when I got the product I had to take it apart to get it working.  Then when I went to use it the next day it wasn't working again.
Watch came without a battery or just not working
It's good for a $10 watch nothing fancy but it works fine
I purchased for a friend and the battery was dead on arrival not to mention the functionality was hard to work.

reviews.review_body: tells time and has a compass what else do you need

It delivers on battery life. That's all I was looking for. Software updates seem to be smoothing out the product launch wrinkles and quirks in terms of the feature set, which is good news (at least they're trying), but it works as a watch and basic fitness tracker just fine.
Aunque es muy básico lo que ofrece, la duración de batería y el tamaño de pantalla lo compensan bastante. A mí me dura 10 dias la batería
Great gift for my grandson.
Battery life does last a week, overall does what a smart watch should do. Not like a phone but a watch.

The app is lackluster and doesn't update as frequently as i'd like with data from the watch. Nice to be able to see texts on watch but can't reply to texts using voice-to-text. Android does this but the watch doesn't support it. Works with spotify and audible allowing you to skip forward backwards and to pause media.

1) One+ Watch
2) Amazon Halo fitness band
3) Apple Watch with Future
4) Apple Watch without Future
5) Fitbit
There you go. Top 5 Fitness watches in order of best after I've used all of them. This watch is also great at answering calls! Literally no one realizes I'm speaking through my watch, they think i just have the phone to my ear. That's how clear it is!!! I love how it seamlessly pairs with my phone too, automatically measures my heart rate, barometric pressure in the air, and much more! Honestly I'm most excited about trying the Parkour mode! While I don't know if it actually teaches me parkour, I'm a life long athlete so I'll learn some how and then record it with this watch! Super excited!
Pretty good product. Paired well with my Oneplus phone. After a update process, watch delivers on battery life and features. I use it mainly for sleep tracking, fitness, phone and text notifications.

As the months go by I'm more and more disappointed with this watch. This thing is so limited in its uses. The app is so limited in information and had such poor user experience. The watch os is clunky as hell and the updates are for I don't know what,because I've seen no improvements. I have used oneplus phones for years, so expected this to be of the same quality and user experience, but it isn't. Don't waste your money.

Works flawlessly with OnePlus phones...  Just download the OnePlus Health app from the Play Store for setup and synchronization.  You can make phone calls, answer calls and talk on it, add more watch faces or customize and personalize using any photo or design to create your own watch face.  Keeps track of workouts and distance's traveled and even add music for listening via Bluetooth.  Battery life is excellent!  I'm on day 15 with 15% battery life left.  I'm personally using it mainly for sleep, health and fitness tracking.  Also phone, text and media notifications.  Just purchased a second one as a gift and they love it!  Recommended: (Y).
Trash
Video Player is loading.
Don't waste your money

For some reason, each time I wear the this watch after the second week, I began to get carpel tunnel in the back of my hand above the watch. I kept thinking that I am wearing it too high up towards my hand, so began to wear it lower on the risk. SAME RESULT.  There has to be something within the watch (when it takes your bodily readings ) causing this. Dangerous.  Too late for me to return it. My wrist is slightly swollen. Watch is no use to me now.

Bought the OnePlus 9pro and smartwatch. BEWARE this is just a fancy looking FitBit. I did not look up reviews before purchase, just assumed the watch would be an outstanding product like the phones.

This should be labeled as a health and fitness watch, not a smartwatch. Very disappointed in OnePlus on this one. I got this for the sole porpoise of reading notifications and keeping on my schedule.

 Making this purchase after so many awesome phones I was very excited to get the smartwatch.

 There is no way to read text messages, it does fit
Fantastic watch. Works great with OnePlus 6

I don't understand how this watch got such a high rating. I have a OnePlus 9 phone and this watch absolutely would not pair with it. I downloaded and installed an update and it slowed the watch to an absolute crawl, until I was finally able to reset it. The pairing keeps failing over and over again. I really wanted to like this watch but it's absolutely useless if it can't pair. I don't understand how a company like OnePlus can release a product that doesn't work with its own product. If you have a OnePlus 9 phone, don't get this watch. I'll be returning mine.
Awesome and worth the price.

As of this writing, I have yet to have the watch turn on. I've had the watch since the beginning of Jan 23. I have a10 plus pro. One plus health won't connect to phone.. Watch gives me a passcode so it not connecting to phone let alone one plus health. Waited for an update. I suppose I bought a ??. Incidently I tried all the options to make it work. Nothing. Shane on OnePlus. Watch should work independent of app. Amazfit t Rex 2 works fantasticly for me
Es fácil de usar la vida de la batería es bastante
Amazing ... My husband loved his watch
Perfect colour. Perfect watch for OnePlus users.
Es una excelente marca uso el celular el reloj y los audífonos son excelentes

I really wanted to love this watch but how can I love it when it failed the basic fit test. The watch strap is absolutely NOT one size fit all, I already applied the tightest notch and it still sit very loose on my wrist. I asked friends who purchased other branded watch and was informed that their watch came with two watch straps, the regular one and a smaller one. I would think twice before purchasing if the description stated that the watch is for people with bigger arm wrists. I did end up keeping the watch and the highlight has to be the fast charge and the insane battery life. It really could last 5-6 days with regular wear. I am having trouble making direct phone calls from the contact list, though. It always show that the call has failed and I would need to dial the number manually for the calls to get through.
Missing some apps. Overall good.

This has been another great OnePlus product. It has exceeded my expectations in many ways, and is a great buy if you don't come into the purchase expecting it to do things that $400 watches are doing... but the battery lasts way longer!
Good basic smartwatch overall, vibration motor is weak but looks good with a great big screen.
I bought this watch for my brother. He says he likes it and giving a good review. 4 star

Compré dos relojes y a uno de ellos no le llegan ninguna notificación de WhatsApp. Eso me tiene muy decepcionada. Si alguien me puede ayudar le agradecería. Delante mano les digo que ya he hecho todo el protocolo que se debe de hacer para que las notificaciones de WhatsApp se puedan activar y nada que lo consigo. La duración de la batería es buena.
I had Samsung smart fit 2. Was good. But this is so much better. So easy to use. Battery lasts be over 2 weeks. Kind of heavy I can't wear all the time will start to hurt my wrist. But I do love it.
Like the tittle said, This pretty smartwatch dont connected with my Samsung with Android 12... I tried with a different phone, with Android 11, and the connection was successfully.

There are a few good things about this watch: first, the battery life is GREAT! I run or exercise 3-5 days a week and it still lasts for a solid 7-10 days. It looks sleek and fits very comfortably.
But I really wish it had more functionality. It is pretty basic for a smartwatch. I have to agree with those who see it as a glorified Fitbit. Pretty limited in terms of features. The app is not very useful, also because it just gives some pretty basic information.
And the biggest problem, and the one that is deal breaker for me is the GPS. It consistently misses the first half mile or so of any run, walk, or hike. Which means all the other numbers (heart rate, distance/steps, etc) are inaccurate or waaay off.
Really wanted to support OnePlus on this, but I just can't. I'm having to shop around for another smartwatch and I've only had this a few months.

Got this to go with my OnePlus 8 Phone and it's been an amazing device. The battery lasts me almost 2 weeks and I've never had an issue with it.

It's easy to turn watch notifications on and off, reassign one of the buttons to go to a specific task (stopwatch, timer, flashlight, etc).

Would recommend to someone looking for a good smart watch!

I bought this as a replacement for my Google smart watch.  It does just about everything that watch did, plus the battery life is amazing!  I also love the bigger screen. I thought it would feel bulky, but I forget it's on my wrist most of the time. I bought it when Amazon had a sale, so I didn't pay as much for the watch.

As with many others, this watch does not stay synced with the weather unless you turn things off and on and off and on. I also wish there was a way to reply to messages other than four automatic responses available. Finally I also wish that I got notifications when they came in not half an hour to 2 hours later.

Having nothing at all to compare too, all I can say is this was easy to set up. I like the easy of adjusting settings and features. I already lost the manual so I'm just pressing buttons until things happen and I've managed to not put it into self destruct mode yet. The Oneplus Health app is pretty helpful so I think I'll just grow happier as I learn to make use of all the functions.

I hate wearing watches so this has been an adjustment. It's growing on me, I do wish the display was ever so slightly less bulky, I have a small wrist so it feels a bit much. It's a small complaint, I'll live through it. Overall I would buy it again.

Pros:
• Fantastic battery life; can go for days at a time without charging.
• Heart rate and sleep monitors seem to work as advertised.

Cons:
• No WearOS. This is basically the cause of all my other gripes, below.
• No watch faces, except those already installed.
• No apps, except those already installed.
• Very limited phone interaction. Alarms set on my phone don't show up on the watch, nor vice-versa. Very few notifications from my phone show up on the watch.
• Requires the "OnePlus Health" app to be running to actually stay connected.

Basically, this is not so much a smartwatch as a glorified fitness watch. If that's all you want, this might be good for you. Personally, I'm checking out an actual WearOS watch next time.

Getting directly to this watch, on paper it was everything that I wanted. It's a fitness tracker with fast charging that works and a good battery life. In reality, this is a rough draft of a product. Sure, it looks nice and does some of the basics well. I even like that it's a bit conservative with steps. It tracked closely to manually counted steps and didn't pick up other actions as steps. Heart rate functionality is perfectly accurate. I compared it against a withings blind pressure cuff, the blood pressure cuff at the dentist and doctors office as well as the one at a blood plasma donation center. It tracks very well against medical grade equipment. It'll that I'm also very overweight. I'm in the mid-300 lbs now after coming down from the mid-400s, I'm used to devices getting these basics wrong or over compensating.

The issues that come into play are numerous. You cannot sync data to Google Fit with the latest version of the app, Google blocks access completely. Some people have found success with a greatly outdated version of the OnePlus Health app, but that shouldn't be necessary.

You cannot disable phone notifications, every call buzzes your wrist. I've gone into settings and disabled every permission. That stopped texts from going through, but calls still come through. I've contacted OnePlus support and they confirmed that the only way to stop this is to uninstall their app.

So their app has a ridiculous amount of access to do whatever it wants on your phone, even when you deny use of every single permission that it asks for.

Since you can't sync to Google Fit, the data is silo'd and it isn't presented well in their own app. I've been bouncing between fitness trackers for about a year now. The OnePlus Health App is the absolute worst one that I've used. I've used $30 bands that did much more, synced to Google Fit and presented data properly while respecting permissions. I've used more expensive watches. This is the only one with this issue and that's highly disappointing.

It's such a shame that OnePlus has created such a beautiful watch that gets some of the fundamentals down well, only for it to ruin the experience in an easily fixable way. I was rooting for them. I don't want a smart phone on my wrist. I don't want data silo'd. I don't want to be tied to subpar software that hinders my ability to track and quantify my health journey. OnePlus can do better, they've just chosen not to do so.

I was a huge OnePlus fan. It seems like everything from them as of late is compromised. Like there's some intentional design flaw because they decided to compromise and this watch is the absolute strongest sign of their fall.

After years of looking at smart watches I could not find one that would sync with my OnePlus phone. I have used this for 6 months now and have never been more pleased with a product. It has great battery life, from 8% to fully charged in less than 30 minutes. Get a full 2 weeks on one charge. I would highly recommend it.

If you own a OnePlus phone, this is a no brainer! Week long battery life and packed full of features. Very large and easy to see Oled display. Fits any 22mm watch bands, which are very common. Seems to be durable and screen has no scratches. Make sure you do all the updates for this and you should be good to go. Highly recommended.

The watch is very comfortable on the wrist.......it's not the watch band you are used to. But once you give a try I would not traid it for a standard band. The face is easy to see even in bright sun. Now.......The app needs improvement to say the least. The watch faces you have to choose from are bland. The sleep data needs much improvement to say the least over my last smart watch. With that said. It paired flawless to my phone that is also a 1+ and the battery last forever. It has a long range from watch to phone. In conclusion I would hope the developers will make improvements.

This is exactly what I've been looking for a long while. A smartwatch that focuses on delivering a basic solution well with excellent battery life at a decent price ($160). So far I have been testing it and it works well, some minor accuracy issues but I work to beat averages so it's not really a problem for me. So far it's perfect for my needs.

Was going to get a new Samsung note 20. But wow, too expensive. So I decided to give OnePlus a try so I bought the 9 pro, buds pro and this watch. Very attractive and works as advertised. Answer phone calls and sounds good and the mic works good too. Nice features that works great. I mainly use the blood oxygen and heart rate. Also works with Google Fit.. The battery is amazing. Last me easily four to five easily with voltage left when I charge it. I swapped the straps from my galaxy watch. It deserves leather straps. ??. Happy with OnePlus products.

reviews.review_body: It worked and works perfectly, it's a real Garmin, and honestly it felt like getting a brand-new Garmin watch for half the price. I would heartily recommend.
Watch does not sync with my phone even after hard reset. Will be returning.
At a third of the original price, this is an unbelievable deal. No difference from brand new. Easy to setup. Great features.

Strange that the product is misspelled in the information. Thought that it might be fake, but bought it on sale, just to take an off chance that it was real. Turns out it is genuine as well as in great quality. If this goes on sale again, I'd recommend getting it quick!

I really like this watch. It's a clean design and the AMOLED looks clear and pretty vibrant. I love that I'm able to track my runs and other activities with this watch and it can sync up to my run apps like Nike and Strava. It might not have all the latest smart watch features like having a microphone and speaker but it does what I need it for and the price I got it for was an exceptional deal. I also like the get I can listen to music on it with my headphones without needing my phone when I go on runs.

I had a magnetic strap on my first Garmin Venu and, sure enough, it eventually got sucked away in mid-chore. I panicked, assuming I would eventually find it (I haven't) but immediately ordered another 'just in case." I don't use anywhere near all its functions but I tend to be sedentary and it keeps me focused on moving. I was fine with the simple Vivofit but they're pretty homely. The Venu looks good and makes me happy.
The battery only lasts about 5 days but it recharges very quickly.

This was my first fitness watch.  Just wanted the most basic and cheap.  TLDR:  it’s been relatively ok and can’t complain since price was so cheap.

Far as the renewed aspect, the watch came looking very new, I wouldn’t have been able to tell you if used or new.  Battery wise, however,I’ve been experiencing problems.  I’d charge at night and when I take off in the morning, it says no battery and needs charging, then I have to plug the charger back in and take out, and then it says 100%.  Not sure if software or hardware.  After first 10 days or so of use, I’m noticing my battery is running out much much faster.  When I first got, I thought would last me a few days between charges, but now, I see the longest it will last is 2 days.  If I work out both days, won’t last even the 2 days and would need a charge on the second day even without gps or music. Im not sure if this is normal for this model or if it’s a refurbish issue.  I suspect this watch won’t last too long because of this battery life issue.  But I intended for it to be my first introduction to see if fitness watches would be useful to me at all.  So far, it’s serving that purpose but I suspect it won’t last half a year due to this battery issue.

I bought because I wanted a cheap watch with basic but reliable functions, I considered returning due to the battery issues that are not instilling confidence, but since replace option doesn’t seem available, only return option available, and because I don’t see any other substitute in this price range with this many features and Garmin sensor reliability, obverse made up my mind to use it until it stops working, not worth the hassle of returning for me.  Since I’ve gotten more used to the watch functionality, I’ve gotten quite attached to it, replaced the horrible strap which has that annoying locking nub on the second loop that made the watch feel so horrible to put on or take off, and got a cheap stretchy nylon band on Amazon, much better.  I found HR seems very accurate and fast.  Functions took a long time to get used to, but since I have gotten used to, feel fine.

Downloading music apps was horrible.  If any problems power cycle the watch and it will start again.  If any problems with this watch first snd foremost power cycle.  Seems to fix a lot of issues.  Deezer and Spotify needs sub fees, so I downloaded Amazon music  instead since I’ve got prime.  Trying to download a playlist takes forever, think maybe half an hour,  but once done, no problems.  Paired with Bluetooth easily.

So far, I’m liking the Garmin way of doing things  once I got used to it.  I mean the quality sensors, no nonsense aspects, no subscriptions required, etc., But battery is concerning and if this watch finally dies a few months down the road, because the renewed price and flash deal price was so good, I don’t think I can complain much.  If it lasts me 6 months, for what I paid, I’ll think I’ve gotten my moneys worth, and I’ll likley look for a similar replacement but maybe a newer model just for the increased battery.

In a nutshell, basic functional smart watch that feels like a very good value if price is factored in.  Suspect battery.
Bad quality, the product got a yellow color a few days after the purchase. I don't recommend it.
excelente inversión. lo compre a mi esposa y esta feliz

[No compensation of any kind was received in connection with this review.]

I'll try to focus my comments on this specific refurbished item, rather than on the Garmin Venu itself.

That said, it's odd that the name of the product is mis-typed.  It arrived in the box pictured in the Amazon listing, a box that contained the watch, a charging cable, and nothing else.  I've got a Garmin Instinct watch that uses the same cable, so this cable is a useful backup.  That also means that I already had Garmin Connect installed on my phone, so setting up the Venu was easy and familiar.  But setup might not be so simple for someone less accustomed to Garmin devices.  The Venu watch was cosmetically perfect on arrival; not a mark anywhere.

Setup and pairing with my phone was easy and painless.  The watch has since updated its software a few times, and Garmin Connect works with it exactly as it does with my Garmin Instinct, which I did not buy as refurbished.  I've installed a few watchfaces with Garmin Connect IQ, and that process was straightforward.  I've played with quite a few of the settings and everything seemed to react as expected.

With Activity Tracking enabled, I get about 6 days on a charge of the battery.  I usually disable that option and then get just over 10 days on a charge.  Admittedly, my usage habits don't stress the battery a lot:  I don't play music on the Venu, I'm not constantly fiddling with it, and my preferred watchface is low impact.  Still, 6 -- 10 days is pretty fair; I'd conclude there's nothing wrong with the battery.

In short, I haven't yet found anything wrong with this product: it appears to be genuine, and it functions as it would had I paid full price.  My reservations (and they are minor) relate to the design and construction of the watch, and those would apply equally to the full priced item.  With that in mind, 5 stars:  this is one of the better purchases I've made on Amazon.  It's the best of many smartwatches that I've tried, and by choosing refurbished I got a discount of around $100 from Amazon's usual price, along with no shortcomings that I can find.  Excellent!

I bought it at a bargain price and Im super happy with my purchase. It is like new. The battery last more than 5days for me as Im not always using gps and just using it as a normal watch. Tested the water resistance as well. Everything works perfect??

reviews.review_body: This has been my go to Freedive watch for years.  I really enjoy the ease.  Once you have all your setting set. Just jump into the water. automatically switches to dive mode.  The alarms are easy to hear, the LED bright to see, and the depth and temp extremely accurate.

Don't get me wrong, it is a great product. But... Before you can use the watch you need to purchase a $100 cord to set it up on your computer. The free version of the software you need does not allow you change the setting, so you have to buy the $24 software. Therefore tack on another $124 to the sales price before you can even take it in the water, without the cord and the software its useless as a dive computer.... If you want to go all out, the app is another $11.
Perfect +
Great watch but a little frustrating at first figuring out how to operate it.  Need to download the manual online.
Works perfect ????

had this watch/computer for just about a year now. dove a couple times last summer worked great as it should have. started wearing it as my everyday watch and stopped 'cause didn't want to ruin it. last month warning showed up that had to change batt already. one year for a batt ? not that good in my book. now I wear a solar dive time piece.

No instruction manual is provided with the product.  I had to download from the internet.  The instructions are poorly written and set up is very difficult.  The instructions provide very little explanation as to what various features are for, and they are badly organized and scattered throughout the lengthy manual.  I've also read a number of complaints that the software doesn't always function properly.  I have a pyle freedive watch I bought for $80 which is so much easier to use.

I think they are are great watch. Something just went wrong with mine. The face went blank after two workouts in the pool. Had to send it back. And am dealing with that now. Must have gotten a lemon. Hope things are made wright with it.
Now I know my bottom time,how could was the water amount all other stuf
Little difficult to scroll through settings but with time it isn’t to bad!
Great watch! Comes with screen protector, durable so far, eady to use.
Simple yet functional. easy to read

reviews.review_body: Otherwise, a 'GREAT' Timex Smartwatch...!!!
I love my watch but disappointed that it’s not the band that way suppose to come with it. I got the stretchy metal band and I don’t like it.
To hard to understand what to do

This watch did not match anything in the description for the item. The watch band looks and feels like something you’d get from wish. Cheaply made! You can’t adjust the screen brightness and there aren’t many replacements bands to buy that will actually fit the watch. Same your money and go with a better option.
Personal use. Replacement for a Smart Watch that quit working after just a few months.

Got it for my tween daughter. The actual watch works great but the pink strap gets dirty pretty easily and is impossible to clean. Have used dish & regular soaps, toothpaste, Clorox wipes but nothing gets the dirt off. Had to buy other straps separately because Timex do not have any fashion 19mm straps in their website. Not even for replacements.

I have owned this watch for 3 months now. The battery used to last about 3 days, now the watch dies in less than 24 hours. Also, the screen is not bright enough when outside. I should have saved the money and bought a Garmin. The touchscreen is also not working well. I can click on icons many times and the screen just doesn’t register. I would give zero stars if I could and should have returned this piece of junk within the 30 day return window.
Update: battery life is deteriorating more and I now get less than 18 hours. It also starts to randomly record activity although this feature is turned off.
Update: Battery life deteriorated more and then improved again to carry a charge for multiple days only to fall off the cliff again.

Save your money and buy a Garmin.
This item is easy to set up and use.  Yes, I’d recommend it to others.

Really love this new smartwatch from Timex. Great price with great features. I use the notifications for text messages and social media updates. Heart rate and workouts are a great benefit and I even added my own photo from my phone as the screen saver. Highly recommend.

reviews.review_body: This watch is excellent and cheaper. 100% recommended

I was excited for the workout feature that identified and tracked my workouts until I discovered the battery life on this watch is roughly 6 hours. At the same use time, my wife's Apple watch uses less than half the same battery power. I would not recommend these watches unless significant changes have been made to the battery.

My girlfriend bought this watch for me for my birthday and I absolutely love it, I see a lot of complaints in the reviews about battery life and I have found if you use the optimized battery settings there is no issue with battery life I mainly use the daily option which limits some functions but still allows an always on display and by the time I get home from work its usually at 50% so I have no complaints there. Everything is easy to use the step counter is awesome its great having all these options right at your wrist. I would definitely recommend this If you're just getting into smart watches and arent sure if you will really use it. But I have to say for my first smart watch I love and I am definitely getting another one when the time comes!

I bought this less than a year ago and it hasn't even been worn daily and then suddenly the screen just stopped coming on. Watch still vibrates. Then I tried charging it and went to take it off the charger and the back literally just fell off. I'm so disappointed because I loved the way this watch looks but the quality is just not there.

I don't know if it's the battery because it's not great or is it that the buttons and crown sick out so for and are very sensitive that your constantly turning on things like assistant especially when you sleep. But Real steel well built looks good a little slow at times processing but wear os on a fossil has a future. It looks like a watch and is feature rich NO not as refined and user friendly as Apple watch 3 up but its no knockoff either. Turn off tilt to wake when sleep if you must keep it on and i do sometimes but as long as it gets me through the day and it does then I'm good with this. Wear OS needs work but its good and you can use the watch with your iPhone but I haven't tried yet I heard you lose tons of features
The battery dies within 6 hours
Watch is too bad at battery life..
Lasted a whole 10 minutes before the screen started flashing red.
Doesn't work. Extremely unresponsive and slow with my android. Screen not very bright
Battery life is horrible but I could have managed that. What was super annoying was hitting the buttons everytime I bent my wrist. It made it the experience in unbearable/returned
Hace un mes que reenvíe los dos productos fossil y solo me han reembolsar uno y el otro no he recibio ninguna noticia favor de informarme que esta psando
Battery dropped 8% from the initial power cycle and down to 30% within a few hours....  Returned for newer model.
Battery dies quicker than i can write this, doesn't do thing's my cheap one does that has proven this brand & watch are obsolete.
Ok
I've had other smart watches, I know how to set them up so it doesn't consume battery. I set it up that way, battery was at 25% at 1pm!!!! crazy how it drains so fast!

The watch is extremely hot, on and off the charger, just simply does not work. Have tried everything to get the notifications to sound, and nothing happens. Now since it is hot, it just stopped working.
Great watch but terrible battery ??
Bought this as a gift for my husband. Difficult to use and does not receive messages like it should. We will be getting an Apple Watch for him!

The watch’s charging mechanism failed after doing exercise with it. The magnetic band came right off and now it doesn’t charge at all.

Great looking watch. But not practical for gym or outdoors sports
very nice smart watch
Todo bien buen producto
Excelente reloj muy lindo
Easy to use very clear screen

I shipped this watch all the way to Nairobi, Kenya only for the charging links to come off and it was in less than a year. Very disappointed with the quality and the silence from fossil on the various forums regarding their smartwatches.
Excelente reloj, llego intacto a mi domicilio en Colombia
My husband loves it
Bought as a gift and they love it and the price was right
Bello
Got this watch for my boyfriend for Father's Day and he love it
Not what i expected for the price
A great value for smart watch. I needed the google app to set up. A good looking watch.

Bad Battery life. 2 or 3
I needed charge it twice a day. (without running apps)
It disconnects continuously.  You need to reconnect at any time to receive notifications.
Many times I did not receive call notifications

The watch looks great. The band is flimsy. The glass on mine cracked. Albeit, I tapped the drywall as lay back and put my hand behind my head. Not even hard, like a oops. Tried calling Fossil was on hold for over an hour. Finally gave up and decided to write this review to hopefully prevent another fellow consumer from having to deal with this bs. Don't make it look rugged when it's flimsy.
I purchased this watch for my husband. He loves his watch and has not taken it off since I gave it too him.
My son loves it. Said the battery wasn’t so good to begin with but then leaving it alone for a night. Seemed to solve it.
This a great smartwatch was a gift and my dad is really happy with their watch. Not is to big, easy to charge and config.
Great watch with excellent battery life and is very easy to use, would highly recommend!
Really good build quality.  Was a breeze to set up and link to my android phone. The battery lasts about a day but that's not a problem for me.

I bought this watch May 2, 2020. I immediately fell in love with it. As my first smartwatch, it became a vital part of my daily routine. I no longer had to occasionally check my phone for notifications, or miss important calls or texts, or manually log my heartrate, etc. I considered this the be one of the best purchases I've made this year....until the charging rings on the bottom disconnected and fell off. Today is July 5, 2020. I noticed on July 3. Two months. The watch broke in 2 months. I reccomend you look elsewhere. Maybe TicWatch. Maybe Samsung. I'm thoroughly disappointed and I hope to spare others the same disappointment. Beware.
Received my watch today and the ban was broken. Like the watch was disappointed about the ban. I was a birthday present.
Looks awesome, but battery life is very poor
It is nice i wish it has more features but I like it

I don't understand the negative reviews about the battery life, it last all day, some people just want to have unnecessary apps on the watch, you can not do that with a smaller device???????.  My boyfriend loves this watch and I have the Fossil GEN 4 womens in silver and Gold and love it.
Not very easy to use but looks nice and when you figure it out works ok

The only con is if you wear this watch on your left writ. Flexing your hand will hit the buttons. If your clumsy like I am I highly recommend getting a screen protector for this.

I bought this watch to work with my Dexcom and it does if anyone's curious. Battery lasts about a day or little less.
Stylish, battery life not bad get about a day with brightness on 3. Easy to use.
Right after I unplugged it it went from 100% to 93% in no time. Like too fast. I plugged it back in reached tye 100% unplugged it and just woke up and it was at 53% ??

Yeah so, this watch is hella confusing to set up *just right*, and that has to happen to use Pay or Workout Tracking.

Other than that, the watch GETS HOT because you use it to workout, and they decided to use glue for the CHARGING RINGS that could NOT handle being worn during a WORK OUT.

If you buy this watch, expect to extract and re-glue every 2 months.

So I've had this watch for FIVE MONTHS and the back charging strip has begun to fall off. It's almost impossible to charge now. It's been a pretty good watch, a bit slow, but over all pretty alright. But I'm definitely not happy with this. It looks like it was glued on there before I bought it. I am a stay at home dad and I'm just wearing it around the house so I haven't been rough on it. Also now that I am outside of the return window, Amazon said they can't help. I definitely feel that I deserve some help to fix this as I have only had this for 5 months and I'm out $150. Not happy.
Really solid watch. Display and ease of access are very clean and very responsive. Takes a day or two to get used to it, but after that it feels amazing.
Got it as a replacement for an older fossil watch I owned. It was a great replacement. Only bad thing is battery life since it only lasts for maybe 8 to 9 hours.

This is one of the best Android Wear smartwatches out there in the market currently and definitely the only one I'd consider buying until Google comes out with its own Smartwatch. Fossil is a very trusted and known brand. Can't go wrong.

Love my watch!!! It fits great, the face is clear and bright.  Very easy to use and set up now the battery isnt perfect mine usually last about 24hrs and then it will need a charge.  Other than that love it and would recommend it to anyone!

reviews.review_body: Nice watch, was updated to the latest OS software, could be better, battery barely last a day..Unless you make changes in how you use it..

To start with I pre-ordered this watch and have been using it every day for the last several months.

I've been waiting a long time for an Android Wear watch to come out with a battery life and features that would make it worth upgrading from my old Galaxy Gear S2 watch. Finally it's here. The battery on this watch lasts almost 2 days (although I charge it nightly) of regular use, always on display enabled, and no power saving settings enabled.

The UI is very clean and easy to use with very few glitches and lag. I like that you have the option for 2 quick apps with the top and bottom buttons. I use the bottom for my Viper SmartStart so I can start my car from my watch.

Sadly I already got a few scratches in the screen. I am used to the raised bezel of the Gear S2 but this doesn't have that extra protection. I like the looks of how flat it is more but it does remove that protection.

As for finger prints, they don't show as much as many other touch screen devices and are easier to wipe off.

Overall I love this watch and am very happy I got it. I plan on getting more Fossil watches because of how great this one is.

I think this watch is working perfectly but whomever said this is rubbish is completely right. This watch is completely unless for me unless I want to turn on my bathroom lights from China.. All I want to be able to do is ask it to remind me to do something and not have to be wearing the  watch and have it show up on any of my devices, especially my Google displays what's your also basically useless.  I think it would at least do that and it does not. The only personal assistant app that works across all devices is Cortana and there is no Cortana enabled watch But there are Alexa enabled watches and Alexa has a Cortana skil. Cortana cannot control two Philue Hue Hubs and according to Googlei you  can't do that either. But you have to trick it and it can do it. So this watch can do that, but it waste of money for me and I'm going to give it and all my Google devices away because suddenly Amazon Alexa has improved 10 times and is really good at controlling everything. I think the Google fit app is absolutely horrific! I have no problems at all when I had an Apple watch keeping track of my fitness and this watch is constantly disconnecting I never know whether it's connec.ted or not and I'm just glad to get rid of it. Soon I'll be back using an iPhone probably. Their watch won't do what I want either. and Amazon support says I can't do that with an Alexa enabled watch what I want to do, but I can because it has Cortana build inside and that's the only personal assistant that actually works across all devices and nothing else does, but it can't control two Philips hue hubs and that's just insane! That's Philips Hue's problem. and when I called Phillips and ask them about that, they said yes you have to have a different account for each hub. They kind of laughed like it was a joke.  and it really is because the Philips Hue app is the worst app for controlling the Philips Hue lights. Alexa does not even have my current account information and it discovers all my devices and so does Siri but Siri I cannot get Cortana or Alexa on the watch so I'm going for one of these $150 Alexa enabled watches and it's going to be the best thing I've ever done. And this Fossil  iwagch is bulky an ugly compared to my Samsung watch which is just as useless. And the watch faces are horrific they're just ugly ugly ugly ugly. I really hate this watch and I hate myself for spending $300 on it. I spent thousands of dollars in smart devices in I think they're all a bunch of junk but if you're going to get anything get all Alexa stuff that's my suggestion it's turned out to be the best of them all.

Had it for about a month and I absolutely love it. The battery lasts long enough for me, although I don't use any of the Google Fit features to save power. Can make it through an entire work shift with still 30% by the end of the day. Only down side is that there are a few apps/features that give me trouble. The find my phone feature only works half the time, other times it says my phone isn't connected, when it clearly is. The spotify app is cool also, but I could never get it to display album covers. I have a pixel phone, so you'd expect this watch to be a perfect match with it. Other than those few things, I'd recommend this watch to any Google pixel owner.

LOVE this watch. I had a misfit vapor before this watch. This watch does everything I want it to and a little more. Easy to turn off features that I won't use. I need to be hands free for work and not touch my phone- this watch solves that. I can see my alerts, read, AND respond to texts (voice to text, auto responses, keyboard, or handwriting responses). I can call from my watch- dial, pick contacts. I can answer calls on my watch and there is a built in speaker + microphone so I can pick if I want to have a speaker call or route the call to my headset (bluetooth) or handset (phone). I can initiate texts from the watch. I can set stopwatch timers on my watch, play games, health tracker, etc.
 I do have a smaller wrist (female) so the bands are a little long. I ended up buying bands and screen/bezel protectors in different colors and now I change my bands/ protectors out to match my outfits.
Very happy!

Have a simple analog dial installed from Facer (hour, minute, second hands and date displayed), and I get about 6 hours of battery life before it kicks into saver mode.  Heart rate monitor is great and matches what my blood pressure cuff says.  I really don't use it for much else than looking at the time here and there. Pretty much have all of the notifications turned off as I work from home and don't need email notifications, etc like I would in an office. I'm also an iOS phone user, so text message notifications do not end up on my watch (but again, my wife and I both work from home so I don't get many text messages during the day.. maybe one or two).  I also find that the watch loses its connection to my phone frequently, even though they are within 2-3 feet of each other all day long.  Not what I had hoped for, works fine when it still has a charge but it is a great looking watch nonetheless.

I finally decided to upgrade from my long lived and well used Fitbit to a proper smartwatch and decided I would give this Fossil a shot, figuring that it would do everything I need it to since I'm not a "power user." Boy was I wrong.

The only two features that I 100% need out of a smartwatch or fitness tracker are the ability to monitor heart rate and decent battery life - neither of these, it turns out, are features of this Gen 5 Fossil smartwatch. It blows me away that my $60 and years old Fitbit Versa is able to consistently monitor my heart rate no matter if I'm running or sitting and yet this $200+ dollar full-blown smartwatch can't manage to read it half the time, even when I'm sitting perfectly still. This is unacceptable, and I honestly don't know how they messed it up this bad. The second problem is the battery life - even with all the cool features turned off on the phone (always-on display, NFC, etc) this smartwatch BARELY manages a full day of very light use.

Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere for a smartwatch. I will either be returning or reselling this one as soon as I can so I can do what I should have done in the first place and get a more reputable brand.

EDIT: I actually came back after using this watch for a few months to bring my score down from two stars to one, and I would give it zero stars if I could. This watch is a straight up piece of garbage, truly. In addition to the problems I mentioned in my initial review, after a few months of use the watch has started having all sorts of software glitches, regardless of keeping the OS updated. For example: every few days all my tiles will disappear, and you can't even re-add them to use them again because the watch still thinks they're there even though they can't be seen or used. I also didn't think this would be possible, but the battery has gotten even worse. Even will nearly every advanced feature turned off, this watch lasts LESS THAN A DAY now of extremely light use. Just stay away from this watch, unless you like wasting money.

I've been in the market for an alternative to the apple watch. I thought that based on the reviews I've read that Fossil Gen 5 would be a good alternative. I really do like the watch except for the fact that the battery only lasted me a day. Having to charge it every night is just not a good thing for me. I tried the alternate power settings but found that they affected the usefulness for me. I'm also a big guy, the watchband could be longer. It's awkward to have to use the last hole in the band.

On the positive front, it is quite good looking. The screen is great, the WearOS from google is easy to use and it has great features for notifications and fitness apps. At about half the price of the Apple Watch, it's a great value. if only the battery was better I'd give it 5 stars.

Pros:  1.) Looks great.  2.) interchangeable watch bands available. 3.) Snapdragon 3100 processor. 4.) Beautiful screen.  5.)  Scheduled for an update on 8/19/20 for additional health apps/features.  6.) Works flawlessly with Android phones.

Cons:  1.) Wear OS is a bit dated. 2.)  Currently not as feature-rich as Garmin or Samsung 3.) Metal watch band doesn't come with tools necessary to re-size the watch band.

Conclusion:

This is a very good general-purpose smartwatch.  It doesn't have all of the health features a dedicated sport watch might have, but that's okay - it's not trying to be a sport watch.  The newer processor is snappy and there are many ways to easily customize the watch to your liking with different watch faces and bands.  It has 1Gb of ram and 8Gb of rom so there's plenty of space to store your favorite songs on the watch.  There is onboard GPS so you don't have to take your phone with you in order to track your run and the battery easily lasts more than a day with almost all of the features enabled.  Glad I bought it and would buy it again.

This is my 4th smartwatch for android. I thought this would be the ultimate watch but was wrong. The hardware specs look awesome but use is under par. Battery life is not good. I can get through the day but have to turn off a few setting that I don't have to on my old watch. No sleep tracking at all. Fossil will tell you that it does using cardiogram app but what good is it. I don't care what my heartbeat is while sleeping. I want to know my sleep patterns like deep sleep and rem. There is no app made for this watch. Fossil says to use the google wear os app. I have it set up and synced with it but the app doesn't have any features like sleep.
I have used and compared stats like battery usage to my old watch and fossil is a failure. I pretty much do my same routine everyday and the results show me to go back to my old watch. I would not recommend it until fossil can truly make this smart watch open up its features.
Update:
After updates and adding sleep tracking, I am pleased with it. Battery is a lot better where I can get almost 2 days now.

I have had 3 fitbits of which all went bad immediately after warranties were expired so I wanted to try something else but not as expensive as a Samsung watch as I have an android phone.
This fossil has horrible battery life and requires you to choose which apps/functions to use, keep active to get thru my nearly 14 hr work day, recharging while doing a.m./p.m. hygiene tasks to get thru the night and day.
I don't have music apps on my phone so no comment on that capability.
I also don't use the phone capability, just to notify me of phone calls, notifications and texts.  You can only respond to texts with standard offered replies.
I also haven't paid attention to the sleep tracking.
I don't work out, just walk alot at work.
I have the smaller face option, and have a small wrist and have the band on the 2nd to last notch.
It doesn't have a vibrating alarm, only tones, which I wish it had vibrating options for silent notifications.
The screen is bright and visible in the sun.
I haven't tried the point of pay option as my banking institution doesn't support that function.
You can also download the "Facer" app which allows you to choose from hundreds of watch faces from free to various amounts with multiple options, colors, designs.

I really wanted to like this watch and hoped this would finally break my "smart watch curse" (every smart watch I've purchased thus far has been trash), but this ain't it.

First of all the battery life is absolute garbage. I mainly use this watch for work and I am lucky if I can make it through the 8 hour mark. Even if it does make it past the 8 hour mark the watch almost always needs to activate "extended mode" which defeats the purpose of having a watch since I can't tell the time with the screen off.

The watch bands are not exactly sturdy either, I actually had to order replacement bands since one side tore off just a few days after recieving the watch ?????. Now granted, as I said, I do use this watch for work and I'm not sure this was designed to be a work watch but I'm not a construction worker or anything, I am a delivery driver for God's sake.

Lastly the overall design of the watch is flawed. I bend my wrist ever so slightly and the power button is long pressed which activates Google assistant which is insanely annoying. Every day at work I hear off into the distance "I'm sorry I did not catch that", making me paranoid that google is listening to me haha. A very flawed design. I've looked tirelessly for a way to maybe map assistant to an on screen button or something instead of the main turn dial, but to no avail.

My girlfriend uses an apple watch and it seems to work so efficiently for her... I've never been an apple kind of guy, team android all the way, as far as phones are concerned anyway, but damnit at this rate I might as well jump ship to apple in the smartwatch department. I don't know what gives with android smart watches.

I'll preface this review with two thoughts: first, the review is based solely on my experience with the watch and my iPhone 8 running iOS 12.4; and second, the Amazon team was very helpful throughout my entire 18-hour trial and refunded the purchase with zero issues.

The cons:

-First, let me touch on the battery life: everything you've heard is true. If this generation has purportedly better life than the previous, I shudder to think of how long a 4th generation lasted. After 14 hours from removal from charger after an overnight charge, the watch was at 11% batter remaining. Not too bad, right? Wrong. The watch was on it's 'power save' mode for the entire duration of this time. It's power-save mode, however, prohibits most of it's useful functions. For example, you must manually turn power-save mode off to even attempt to use Google Pay. The watch does, however, charge fully in a little over an hour.

-Now the real killer: iOS compatibility. While it's iOS compatibility isn't marketed as heavily as it's 'extended battery life,' it is equally as abysmal. Extremely frustrating to initially pair with the phone. Then, once it's paired, it will erratically disconnect throughout the day unless the Google Wear OS is actively open on the paired phone. Reconnecting is usually a series of button presses in the application and on the watch itself. Not through the usual Bluetooth interface. To compound the matter, manually removing the watch from my remembered Bluetooth devices (in an attempt to avoid further connectivity issues) led to an odyssey spanning two-and-a-half hours that included a hard factory restore of the watch and the painfully long process of re-adding all my payment methods to Google Pay and pushing them to the watch. No, it's not automated nor a simply login process. I question the developer's marketing of this product as iOS compatible.

Pros:

-The watch itself is beautiful. Infinitely more attractive than any Fit Bit or Apple Watch I've ever owned or seen.

-Charging is very quick (45 minutes to an hour-fifteen)

-Lightweight

-No issues with water resistance

Conclusion:
It's a beautiful timepiece. I cannot stress that enough. I could honestly deal with the battery life if it wasn't essentially a piece of non-functional jewelry when regarded with iOS in mind. I was seriously considering just buying an extra charger and charging in my car when required. That was before I realized the compatibility issues, of course. While it may be a great watch, it's definitely not something I'd switch to an Android for.

TL;DR:
Poor battery performance and iOS compatibility. Shockingly beautiful watch.

Even after owning this watch for nearly two months, I'm struggling with the battery life and it's the biggest disappointment.

I've tried custom profiles, I've disabled WiFi and Location services, I've uninstalled apps, I've set Bluetooth on a schedule, but my custom profiles get me at absolute best 2 days of battery with tilt-to-wake disabled and severely restricted functionality.  Even the default extended battery mode doesn't get me to the 3 day mark.

If I enable tap-to-wake, bluetooth, wifi, and location services, I'll have maybe 20% battery by the end of the day.  I've got a fancy watch face from Facer running, but I've tried only using basic preinstalled watch faces and they don't change the battery life.

Sometimes, randomly, my watch will show "not connected".  It will not be outside the Bluetooth schedule hours,  Bluetooth will be enabled on the watch and my phone, but Notifications don't cooperate.  Most of the time, for that matter, the WearOS app on my phone indicates "disconnected" even if the connection is working just fine.  All apps involved are up to date, the watch has all updates installed, both devices get rebooted at least once a week.

As far as the activity tracking capabilities of Google Fit and the core functionality of the watch and WearOS, it's all great.

I really want to love this watch, but there's definitely some frustrating aspects.

I really wasn't surprised by anything about this watch. Got just what I expected. Battery life that is well, not the best but I also have all of the fancy features turned on. The battery will last from 7am to 12 to 1am usually. Sometimes it appears to use a little more power with updates and stuff. It definitely feels that once you start really putting a load on the watch, the battery life significantly decreases. Inconsistent with the battery life based on load. For example, a little load uses a little battery. While a lot of load uses a lot of battery x2. So if you have a lot of updates pending I definitely suggest you have a charger near by. It's worth noting I don't have an issue with the battery life, some may think this watch should have an unrealistic battery life. No it's not ground breaking. It's far from where apple is at. But with everything in mind the 17+ hours from this watch is more than enough for me. The screen looks nice and has a high ppi. The watch doesn't lag behind under normal use. Heavy use could slow it down but not enough for it to really bother me. Worn it at work with pressurized water flying everywhere. Hasn't broken it yet. Washed my hands with it in all the time. It definitely seems to meet what standards I do have in order for it to be a realistic replacement for a traditional watch.

This is my second Gen 5 so when setting up the watch, DO NOT add your account yet. Go through the setup and go to Settings>General>About>System Update and update the watch. THEN add your account. If you try and add it before, it TAKES FOREVER to download the update and all the other apps and whatnot so just a heads up.

Like mentioned before, this is my second watch. I bought one from Best Buy and it was INSANELY slow and the vibration did not work at all. So I ended up returning it. I gave it another shot since I had some Amazon gift cards from Christmas and this one is waaaayy better. I was debating between this and the Samsung Active 2 but that one is just way too expensive, plus I'm not a big fan of their OS for the watch.

Battery life is great (I have extended battery mode on) and have about 50% at the end of the day. I don't think the heart rate monitor is accurate but it may be because I don't wear it really tight to my wrist. Everything else is really good.

The ONLY issue I have with this watch is I keep pressing the main button on the side when I'm moving my hand backward. It gets pretty annoying at times but for what I paid for it, I can live with that.

Probably the best Wear OS watch out right now. I would definitely recommend.
This watch actually deserves better

Tuve el Explorist Gen3 y la batería era mala, y tenía temor que fuera igual, en este caso la mejora es notable, yo uso el HR con frecuencia de cada 5 minutos, y aun así me dura alrededor de 2 días la batería, puede llegar a durar hasta 5 días con otras configuraciones.

Las 4 estrellas son por el diseño: Desde el gen3 que el diseño era mucho más atractivo, con el case azul metálico oscuro, y el strap de puro cuero, en este el case es negro como verán, versátil pero no tan bonito como las versiones anteriores, y el strap es de un lado cuero y del otro silicón, además de no ser 100% cuero es un poco incómodo ante la humedad o sudoración de la muñeca y yo le preferí comprar otro strap 100% cuero.

Las funciones han mejorado, el reconocimiento de voz es mejor que la versión anterior.

Estoy bastante satisfecho.

I like the features the watch offers, it's honestly more than I need. However, the battery can become a bit drained when the heart feature is on constantly. If you limit that and don't have a constant stream of notifications, it seems to hold its charge for most of the day. My main gripe with the watch is how sensitive it is. I've had the watch for around a week and it has already come undone many times, two of those times the screen completely disconnected from the band and fell on the floor. The pins that separate the watch face from the band are very easily triggered. Thankfully, it still works fine. It also refused to turn on at one point for seemingly no reason, but the issue resolved when I gently wiped the pins that connects the watch to the band. Overall fairly happy, but it's definitely not perfect. I'm not sure how long it will last.

Battery life is not to the standard I was hoping. For the price of this watch you would think you wouldn't need to worry about your watch dying sometime in the middle of the day because you chose to turn on all the features you wanted to have on. I have had trouble with the maps app and getting it to pin point my actual location so that is a big let down and answering phone calls doesn't always work properly even though I have all the settings correctly turned on. I have only had the watch about a week ago in hoping any other issues in having I can figure out some way to fix and get working properly. I Wish the watch came with some kind of written instructions instead of figuring everything out with trial and error. There is a definite learning curve because of no instructions so I hope I can figure everything out that I need to I order to use the watch to my complete satisfaction. The touch screen works wonderfully and very smooth transition from one screen to the next.

This is my second smartwatch. Originally I had the original Asus Zenwatch. It finally became obsolete and unable to function with current software. After searching and reviewing I decided on the Fossil Gen 5 Carlyle. Love it. It had all the features I want and then some. Like everyone, I wish the battery life was better, but I'm also a heavy user. As in, when wearing my watch I hardly ever remove my phone from my pocket. This was easily solved by purchasing a two pack of chargers. I keep one in the car and one at work along with the original charger on my nightstand. The sleep tracking is good, but doesn't seem to track when I take a nap during the day. I'm a cancer patient and sleep odd hours at times. I like to track my sleep to ensure I'm getting enough. It doesn't track day time sleeping, it seems. The NFC for payment works great and I've added it as one of my buttons for easy access at check out. If you want a good smart watch, check this thing out.

This is the saddest watch I've ever owned, and that includes the cheap digital watches that died in like a month that they gave out at funfair when I was a kid.
It can't hold a charge for butkus. The sleep monitor gets 1 star because when you're sleeping, you need to be charging it. So it doesn't know whether you're sleeping. It's in it's frogging charger.
The charger is this weird proprietary thing, btw. Too hard to just put a normal charge port on it, I guess.
The apps are useless, and the notifications are hard to tune to what you want and annoying.
If I turn off Bluetooth on my phone, this pos gets confused and forgets what time its is. Really? You're a watch, bro. You should be able to remember the time without my phone.
Worst, it never worked as a heart monitor with the app I bought it to use with in the first place (Supernatural).
I'm mad I spent money on it, and also mad I have to take time warning you not to buy it.
Do better, Fossil.

Feature-wise the Fossil Gen 5 is very appealing, however as it advertised as a smartwatch for exercise, before I found out that its heartrate (HR) reading was significantly OVER the actual heartrate, which made me even worried about if I got serious heart problems!!!
I'm in good health and have been walking and running regularly for 12 years, I thought a smartwatch like Fossil will help me better monitoring my heartrate during exercise. As I was wearing Fossil Gen5, I found out that my regular walking will quickly ramping up a HR of 120+ even it's only a 3 mph pace. My running HR also displayed quickly from 160 to 190 with a mild 4.2 mph!!! I'm 65 with a max. recommended HR in 155. So it really bothers me since I'm aware that I got lots of capacity to run faster but the HR display shown is seriously beyond my limit!
Luckily I searched on the web and found an article titled "Fitness trackers aren’t very accurate at measuring heart rate — and that can be dangerous" :https://www.theverge.com/2016/10/13/13268506/fitness-trackers-heart-rate-apple-watch-fitbit-mio-basis

I decided to compare the Fossil HR vs. Oximeter's reading. What I found is that Fossil HR reading at resting or casual moving is pretty accurate compared with Oximeter. But during exercises, this is what I found out:
1. For walking: When the FOSSIL HR numbers in 120 range, it's 25+-5 OVER compared to Oximeter reading
2. For running: When the FOSSIL HR numbers in 160 range, it's 50+-10 OVER compared to Oximeter

I almost wanted to see my cardiologist for extremely high HR reading during exercises, luckily I found out that it's a problem from the Smartwatch's reading rather than my heart. Fossil is a very reputable company, it should really make it a known issue to the customer, so people knows if it can be used to monitor HR during exercise. Or it should improve the accuracy of the HR sensor and firmware/software, so consumer can get a more reliable readings for their exercise.

Caveat, I like Wear OS, so of course I like the software of this watch. That being said, here's my evaluation.

Battery Life: 1 day of battery life if you put it on Daily mode during the day and battery saver at night. I turned off a couple features that I don't use such as wifi and nfc, and I charge it on my way to work, and I usually wake up the next morning with 20-30% left.

Lag: I had a Fossil Sport (gen4) and it would freeze often, esp if you accidentally triggered the Google assistant and the wrist gestures had to be exaggerated to work. Thanks to an upgrade of memory and ram, this watch doesn't have that problem, it's pretty snappy, the wrist gestures just work and the few times I've used Google Assistant have been good.

Notifications: I had a fitbit versa 2 with a 5 day battery life, and notifications are why I'm back on wear os. They just work, whereas the fitbit would just not connect every couple days, which was very annoying.

This is my second Android Wear device and like my Moto 360 before it, it's basically a paperweight after 2 years. Around the 1 year mark, I started noticing a steep decline in battery life. Where I could previously go a full day with all features enabled and still have about 30% battery when I threw it on the charger, it got to where I might get 12 hours on a charge. At about 18 months, it started doing this thing where it just randomly shuts down and the only way to wake it up was by putting it on it's charger. I've now owned it for about 2.5 years and it is effectively dead. This does not make me want to get a new Android Wear device if they're going to be bricks in 2 years.

Pros:
1. The black one looks great.
2. It is very responsive, unlike my other two Android Wear watches.
3. Battery life is actually good even with heavy usage like constant IMs and emails, often read from the watch.
Cons:
1. Too expensive - Fossil is not as strong tech brand as Samsung, yet Samsung watches are cheaper with the same functionality.
2. The heart rate sensor is useless - it measures higher rate than actual when moving (when you need it the most) and lower rate when not moving much (e.g. weightlifting). Effectively, one needs a separate fitness watch for workout or stress management.
3. The battery modes are sticky - e.g. if the watch reaches 15% of battery, it helpfully suggests more conservative mode, but that mode remains even after the phone is charged. In my case, I ended up with a $300 watch that had the functionality of a $20 one until I figured out how to reverse the change.

Update (01/16/2021): #3 above self-resolved after a few updates, but unfortunately ~14 month after I bought it, the charging ring fell off. It turned out that the glue that holds it is not very strong. I tried to glue it back but it still wouldn't charge. I am keeping the 4 stars as the watch lasted over a year.

I have owned this watch for about two years now. It has been a good watch for the most part, except that you have to turn a lot of the features off in order for it to make it through the day. When I first got it, I thought that I was doing something wrong. I figured it would make it at least 24 hours on a charge, but not the case. I am a realtor and I am always getting texts and in meetings. It's good not to have to pull out your phone all the time, but I was hoping for a bit more generous battery size and life. Not that I always have to dim the screen and turn of bluetooth and wifi. Hoping next gen will beef up the battery.

This watch does everything I need it to do.  It has helped me pay more attention to my physical activities as well as my sleep habits... And since I am more aware of my health thanks to the watch, I have already seen a noticeable improvement.  I feel stronger and have more energy now that I pay more attention and have been more physically active since purchasing the watch.

 Outside of health benefits I am loving the convenience of using my watch to control my music and podcasts when I am out and about on my walks.  I have a Galaxy note 20 ultra, which can be unwieldy at times and the watch makes it so much easier to use as a control hub as opposed to constantly pulling out and putting away my phablet.  I love the versatility and ease of switching bands depending on what I'm doing. The Stainless steel band is great for more formal situations while the silicon band is extremely comfortable when performing physical activities and sleeping at night.  Considering how much I use the features of my watch, the battery life is perfect. It always lasts over 24 hours so I only need to charge at once per day when I'm showering and getting ready in the morning.

I got this watch not too long ago, and I'm actually surprised how good it is. Navigation around the watch and opening apps is super smooth and pleasant. If I want to pay for something, I've mapped Google Pay to one of the buttons, and it opens and is ready to pay immediately. This is super convenient for me since I don't like to carry a lot of cards, but really want to maximize how many points I can get. Notifications come through consistently and immediately, and the battery life has been great. Right now, it's 8 PM, and I still have over 70% (though admittedly, I haven't really used the watch much today). I also really love using the crown to navigate the watch. I previously had a smartwatch without one, and this is a huge improvement. I also really like the way this watch looks compared to essentially any other smart watch.

So far my only complaint is that Google Assistant doesn't launch quite as fast as I'd like. Ideally, I'd be able to hold the crown and speak the instant I feel feedback, but that doesn't see to work. I have to wait until the assistant shows that it is listening. This is annoying enough that I've mostly stopped using the assistant on the watch.

I can't really comment on the fitness aspects of this watch, as I don't really use them. I tracked a couple walks, and it seemed to work, but I really have no point of comparison.

Pretty decent features, will be slow at first but over time it will ware in and update to a rather fast and convenient watch. Spotify needs some work for wear os to not be a remote only.
Battery life is decent, it lasts me through work and the drive home and usually ends up with 45% at the end. I constantly track my heart and it monitors every minute.
The battery life is also supplemented with an extremely quick charge time.
It goes from 45% to around 70 or 80 in about 7 minutes for me.
It is durable, I work in an Amazon wearhouse and it has taken some rather harsh knocks and bumps, the screen doesn't scratch even when it frubs against jagged steel from the carts.

Heart rate and sleep tracking are very good and monitor in real time, it perfectly calculates what time I go to sleep at and wake up at, with good gps and other features.

All around if asked to buy this watch as a gift I would, but the initial break in time was rather disconcerting. If you buy it give it about 1 or 2 weeks to get all the updates and really got to work. It's a superb watch for the price I paid.

It is light weight, inconspicuous/minimalist, reliable, and a great value.
100/10 would recommend to anyone considering getting a smart watch.

I hadn't worn a wristwatch in years, now I never leave home without it. This watch is stylish and elegant.
I was disappointed to find that it does not track sleep, however, I did bit purchase this watch for that purpose.
