reviews.review_body: Bought as a gift. Arrived in perfect condition. Recipient loves the features and design. Easily swaps out the link band to leather strap for an every day look.

I bought this watch with the intent to filter calls and texts while working. If it's not on the dial it's not worth looking at immediately.

I hate the look of the blank smart watches! For me the only watch is a sleek analog design. But I wanted to try a hybrid type and see how i incorporated it into my routine without compromising design. So far it's helpful and not distracting. My smartphone is always on me, so advanced functions are still taken care of.

I love having my watch alert me and give me basic information like who is calling/texting. This feels just like my other Fossils too.

The battery is expected to last a year, but the replacement is about $1-2 and the tool to open the back comes with the watch. Fossil will replace it for free too!

Pro:
Design
Usability
Don't have to ever charge
Quick recognition of iPhone information

Con:
Replace the battery yearly (approximately)
Not very waterproof
Reports of the step tracker not working very accurately
Limited number of alert notifications
Other models (like my wife's Accomplice) don't share the same number of features
Great watch but unfortunately it cracked when wearing it in cold weather. Normally watch glass should be able to withstand this temperature range.

Purchased in Hawaii almost 2 1/2 weeks ago. Watch face has cracked already and I do not know why. The watch did not notify like it should have. It’s unfortunate that it costs as much as it did. Would have been better off with a gas station watch. Perhaps the company should change its name to suggest something more product quality appropriate.
its a great looking watch. The functions work. The smart watch capabilities are limited, but I was taught to read a watch and I like the classic watch face instead of a digital screen.

This is a light, comfortable, attractive and elegant watch. It has a black and silver linked band, and a smoky crystal over a roman numeral style dial.  The dial is a bit on the dark side and although its easily readable in bright light, it is hard to see in darker places. Setting up my Fossil Q was as easy as downloading the app and following the instructions - it took only a few seconds for my mobile device to find and pair with my watch. It was kind of fun watching the hands move around as it set the correct time (entirely on its own). There was a brief exercise using onscreen buttons to calibrate the watch, although truth be told I didn't need to make any adjustments.  The band is comfortable and easy to use - it has a push button release on the back.  I will probably end up removing a link or two though as the fit is looser than I like. There are three buttons on the side of the watch for enabling smartwatch features. The features are limited, but useful. You can control music playback, receive vibrating messages, notifications, select contacts for expedited calling. It also has some health tracking features, like a step counter and a sleep monitor.  I suspect that, like many other software driven items, the feature set will grow with time.

I was able to connect this very nice looking 'low-key smartwatch' to my cell phone without any difficulty at all. Low-key meaning that it is mostly meant to be a nice-looking, fashionable watch but it is still able to pair with your phone to offer some smartwatch-like capabilities. The most obvious difference from most traditional smartwatches is that there is no digital screen nor any lighting. Unlike some of the other Fossil smartwatches, this model has no USB charger and you need to change the battery like a traditional watch. It does include a "Q" shaped key to let you access the battery, but it can also be opened with a coin. It was kind of cool to see the dials move very fast during the pairing - this process is basically to let you know that the phone has successfully paired to your phone via bluetooth. Just keep in mind that you will need to download an app on your smartphone in order to take advantage of this function. It is able to count the number of steps that you take, but this is probably not intricate enough for sporting activity - just for general daily walking. It also has a sleep quality monitor, but I personally don't think that this watch is comfortable for sleeping. I would also mention that this watch is on the heavy side - which I personally like but some people might not.
Beautiful watch. Only issue is that the battery gives out quickly.

If you want the look of a classic watch with the ability to receive notifications that's pretty much what you're getting. I picked this up for my husband and he liked it for about a week before he found that he preferred a regular watch or a smart watch, the hybrid just wasn't for him.

I'm having tons of fun getting acquainted with Fossil's Q Grant hybrid smart watch. Fossil is a worldwide brand who has leveraged its ingenuity in watchmaking to launch Fossil Q, an innovative line of hybrid smart watches. I believe the Q Grant is the perfect watch for today's lifestyle.

I like that Fossil respects the artistry and tradition of fine watchmaking. The stainless steel construction and intricate design makes a very favorable impression, indeed.  The twist is that unlike my grandfather's watch, I can connect the Q Grant to the Fossil Q app on my smartphone; opening up some very interesting and useful possibilities.

To begin, I downloaded the Fossil Q app to both my tablet and iPhone. Pairing the watch took only a few moments.  When complete, the time hands on the watch automatically moved to the time indicated on my tablet (I presume this auto sync will eliminate the daylight savings time hassle going forward, too).  I found the very clean, uncluttered interface of the Q app to be intuitive and easy to use.

The Fossil Q app allows me to use the Q Grant to track my sleep, steps and fitness goals. The app can also be used to set alarms. A press of the button on the lower right can be used to stop/play music, ring the phone and take photos.  I think it's simply an elegant solution to making online technologies accessible when using a device of high integrity.

I've attached a selfie to this review that I took with the Q Grant. All I did was set my iPhone on a table with the camera app open. Then I pressed the button on the Q Grant. Snap - my iPhone captured the moment!  What a great way to take photos virtually hands-free.

Fusing the best of old and new technologies, I highly recommend Fossil's innovative Q Grant smart watch to everyone.
Beautiful watch.  I had to return it though because it was very heavy and bulky.

I will preface this by saying we are pretty low tech in our household, but open to tech that improves our lives.
I use my fitbits pretty much daily.
We wear watches.
My husband hates the look of fitbits, so i thought this smart watch would achieve same purpose

First, he didn't like the size or weight.

Second, he said it is difficult to read the face, needs lighting and crystal clear face.

Third, he doesnt want a watch telling him about missed calls. If he isnt carrying phone its because he is choosing to wisely disconnect for a while.

So, after trying this, he agreed to use fitbit as lesser of two evils to monitor fitness.

Functions worked well, although step counter signficiantly different from fitbit, phone, and old school pedometer when we tested.

Beautiful watch but very hard to read in dark or dim lit situations. “Hybrid smart watch” functions are a joke- pony up the cash for an Iwatch if you want a smart watch- not only is this hybrid impractical, it is also useless unless your iPhones Bluetooth is always on, eating your phone battery up. If it was back lit I’d give it two more stars but a watch that needs a new battery 3-6 months, is not waterproof, does not take pictures, does not “play” music, or accurately monitor steps, calories, and sleep(which the devices advertises, but disclosed in manual that accuracy is not promised or guaranteed) is not worth the asking price. I might pay half of what they’re asking if it wasn’t given to me as a gift based on the watches over-all stunning beauty. Beautiful watch, but beauty is pretty darn expensive for being a heavy, non-practical time piece

My husband loves this watch, and no wonder - it's good-sized and heavy - and a Fossil, a brand we both love. On top of that, it's a fitness tracker. Until now, he has used an app on his phone for tracking his steps - he doesn't want to wear a typical fitness tracker, but loves knowing he's walked his five miles every day.  Thus, this big manly-looking watch is absolutely perfect for him.

This smart watch pairs with your phone and is able to notify you about texts and emails from the contacts you choose. It will also track your sleep habits if you want it to and  lets you set up goals and check them off if you're so inclined.  It's easy to connect the watch to your phone - you just download the app and get going.

This chrome and black watch, with its dual-tone stainless steel wristband, is heavy and solid on your wrist, which is exactly what my guy likes.  The face has Roman numerals. It's good-sized but the lack of contrast makes it hard to see for older eyes, especially at night. That's the only reason I knocked off a star.

The watch operates on a battery, not a USB charger, but the great thing is that you can change the battery yourself - it even comes with a little tool to open the battery compartment. All in all, it's a beautiful watch if you are into traditional analog timepieces with the added smart features.

This is a beautiful watch but it does have a few issues. it is a bit heavier than average, which is fine for a regular stylish watch, but if you are wearing it for its fitness tracking capability, then you might be wary since you may be tempted to take it off when you get home from work and get comfortable. It was a bit too big for me at first but I easily took out a couple of links and now it fits really well. It was packaged beautifully and came with everything I needed.

I do enjoy the smart feature of being alerted with the hand movements whenever my friends or family are texting or calling me. It's a really cool feature that I haven't seen on any other watch.

My main complaint with this watch is that it is not backlit, making it very difficult to read. I would not buy this again unless a light were added.

I've enjoyed using a fitness tracker, but it didn't function as well as a watch.

If you are considering this watch, it's likely you want it for the watch feature and look first, and as a fitness tracker second, but there's a feature in the watch that's hardly mentioned but that owners of this style of watch are likely to find very useful.

It's called Goal Tracking.

Yes, the watch can track the traditional steps and sleep, but it can also tracks Goals. It's one of the three sections (see screenshot).

At first it seemed like it was just fitness goals, but no. You customize the goal. One example they give is "Say hello to someone new today." You perform your goal, and then you press the lower button on the watch and it catalogs that you achieved you goal.

Now for professionals and executives, this can be a very powerful tool. Say you want to accomplish a certain task each day. This could be related to work (spend 30 minutes sharpening the saw, for example), or spend 10 mindfulness minutes, Spend 30 minutes writing, or make a sales call, etc.

Point is, you can customize the goal, and then each time you reach the goal, you can track it by pressing the button. I thought it would be silly, but it's one of my favorite features.

Now on to the other features

-- Adjusting the links --

The watch does not come with a link adjuster, just FYI. So to remove a link to adjust the band size, you'll need a link adjuster tool.

The watch does come with a tool (in the shape of a Q) that can be used to remove the battery casing.

-- Face Size --

This is a large watch, and it took some getting used to, but I like it.

-- Coloring --

The grey background as well as the grey hands blend together a little when making a quick glance to the watch. I've gotten used to it, and overall the look is elegant. It'd be interesting to see if other owners feel the same. The minute hand is colored orange at the tip as well as the step indicator. so that helps.

-- No Light --

My biggest regret is that the watch doesn't have a light. Really wish it had that. The hands do glow in the dark, but it's pretty subtle.

-- As a Fitness Tracker --

The steps are accurate as far as I can tell. It's different from my other fitness tracker, but after counting steps for a bit, the Fossil Q seems pretty accurate.

The step data can import into the Apple Health App but as of this writing, the Sleep Data cannot. Maybe they'll get that fixed. Accuracy here was similar to my fitness tracker when tested against each other.

I love that at a quick glance, I can see the progress of my fitness goal from 0% achieved to 100%. I don't have to press any buttons to see progress.

It helps me be more conscious of my fitness goal because I immediately see my progress with each look at the watch.

-- Other Features --

The watch can be used as an alarm, with a press of one of the buttons, you can view the date, or even another time from a time zone you select which is handy if you need to do business with a company in another time zone or on the other side of the world.

The watch vibration notifications can be adjusted in strength. The lowest setting is almost imperceptible. You can set vibration notifications for texts and calls, but for me, that's not as handy. I don't need something to connect me to calls and texts. The fitness and goal tracking are the most beneficial features for my use, but the other features are there if you want them.

-- The App --

I was surprised by the elegant design of the app. Good job on that, Fossil. I haven't noticed errors or crashing in use with an iPhone.

-- Do I miss my separate Fitness Tracker Watch? --

No. I've found myself using this watch exclusively throughout the day.

It's a great blend of tradition, style, and function.

-- Two Word --

Love it.

This is a really nice looking watch with a big face, which I like. It has the watch feel that one wants. Although this watch weighs 6 ounces, which in my book is on the heavy side. Out of the box it easily sync'd with my phone so from there all I had to do was use the features on my phone to talk to my watch. We were curious how this would be a smart watch and show its use. If the face showing analog and will switch to a digital face? If so cool! The answer is no. The watch itself tells you the time and the day. It will notify you of alarms you have set on your phone. It will control the volume on your phone and you can set it up to work with your phones camera to take pictures. Which is pretty cool. But most communication is done with your device. Removing links to adjust size was easily done as well as the smaller adjustments in the band coupling. So after making size adjustments and syncing it to my phone I started to play with it. I'm really curious about the step counter. My phone has one inside so that went in the back pocket and the watch on the wrist. The numbers didn't match, not even slightly. One has to be moving their arms in order to get the step counter to register steps. The problem with that is if you are working on something that requires a lot of hand movements it over counts your steps. But on the other hand if you spend your time hauling stuff to and fro with your hands then your steps will not be counted. I'm sure it all comes out in the wash with an active day. My last observation is the crystal, it is tinted a smokey tint. Which makes it harder to see in darker rooms and at night. The hands are glow in the dark which helps if you a bit. There is no backlight to illuminate the face for viewing.

I like the watch but it is much heavier than I would like and was hoping the "smartwatch" capabilities would be better. It is a nice dress watch though and has that classic analog look we like. I do wonder about the battery and how often I will need to change it.

This is my first foray into smart watches, and I have some issues.  Let’s start with the basic concept.  As smart watches go, this one is pretty minimal.  I am an analog guy, and this is an analog watch, which is the only reason I would consider it.  So, its smart watch functions are minimal.  Mostly, it is a health tracker.  The main issue with it as a health tracker is its weight.  In order for a watch to work as a health tracker, you have to wear it consistently, and a watch of this weight just doesn’t work in that capacity.  Fit bits work because they are so light that people will just wear them all the time.  I won’t because I want a real watch.  I prefer lighter watches these days, though, and with something of this weight, which is heavier than the truly slim, minimalist watches I like these days, I certainly won’t wear it constantly.  I will take it off when I get home from work, and won’t put it on until I leave in the morning, and that defeats a lot of the purpose.  If a heavier watch is not something you will wear 24/7, then this won’t work as a fitness tracker for you.

Other than the fitness tracker, its “smart” capacities are minimal.  It will notify you of texts and emails from selected contacts, and the hands on the dial will rotate in a coded way to show you who is trying to contact you.  That’s about it.  That isn't the most efficient way to convey information, and that doesn't really impress me.  Other than that, it’s a big, heavy-ish watch.  It's not one of those gargantuan monstrosities, but a while ago, Vine gave me one of those nice, slim little Lucien Piccard things that I often wear, and in terms of weight, there just isn't any comparison.

Also, keep in mind the metal band problem.  Metal bands have an intrinsic “rounding error” problem with regard to the size of your wrist.  You have to remove a fixed number of whatdoyoucallems, and the band will likely be either too tight or too loose.  If it is too loose, you may not get the best readings.  I didn’t think much of the readings I saw, particularly the step tracker.

Do I have anything positive to say?  It’s a nice-looking watch.  Good feel, and actually, the band release is kind of cool.  On its own, this is a decent watch.  Worth wearing, and my wife says that it works as a decent, not-too-dressy kind of thing.  I'll have to trust her judgment on that.  I just don’t think much of the smart features, given the weight, and my unwillingness to wear it at all times.  However, the price is based on the smart features, making this, in my opinion, overpriced.  But, that depends for you on how heavy a watch you like.  I like slim, light watches.  If that isn't you, then go for it.

If you are willing to wear a heavier watch at all times, and want an analog watch that does step-tracking, etc., then this is probably a good choice for you.  However, this is not the droid I was looking for.
Absolutely love this watch.
My dad loves his new watch
My husband absolutely loves this watch. No complaints.
Exactly what I wanted, connected and waterproof
Perfect Fathers Day gift! My husband loves it!
My husband loves it and wears it every day

very nice watch
a gift, and he loved it
It took a minute to set up but after that works as they say
Great seller. Nothing but good things
Really enjoy the watch worth the money
Love It ! works great ! Looks sharp ! great gift for a guy ...
I love this smartwatch! quick shipping, excellent conditions ans more beautiful than image!
Got this for my birthday.  This is a solid, great looking watch.
My boyfriend loved this watch, I didn’t realize it was a smart watch which was an added bonus!
It stop working after six months. too late to return it.
really cool watch.. not need to recharge... it has battery and bluetooth function .. so cool
Love this watch I have 12 fossil watches at this time and by far this is my fave...
I have replaced the glass two times in 11 months only had it 12 months

No issues connecting to phone or updating time. A nice just-smart-enough watch. Activity tracking seemed to only track half of my steps (just my left foot?) and the entire face cracked after 4 months.
Looks awesome
Classoc look. Awesome concept. Works well most time, sometimes does not link to app properly.

I love this watch.  I wanted a smart watch but also wanted a classic watch,  this is the best for needs.  So many options and i don't get alerts from every contact or phone call only the important ones.  I wish i would have bought it earlier.
Works great, exactly as described. I could think of some better uses for some of the function buttons, but pretty good overall. Plus it looks great!
Honestly I was expecting more for the price. It a beautiful watch but it’s not durable. My husband’s going watch broke after only a few months use.

While I love the smartwatch features, the grey face is darker than the pictures make it out to be and the black numbers and grey hands are hard to read in anything but bright light (because it doesn't have a backlight).

I'm returning it and getting a different color (model FTW1158--white numbers and hands with a black face).

Not sure I am happy to know how inactive I really am, but it is good to know how well i sleep and it is going to motivate me to start doing more walking once the weather gets nicer.  Oh and it isa good looking watch that keeps great time too

Horrible Fitness Tracking.  It looks awesome and most of the features are amazing BUT if you are looking for this to be an accurate Activity Tracker then DO NOT WASTE your money.  I wore this side by side with My Fitbit charge and tested against a 3rd Device(IPhone 6s).  Both the Fitbit and IPhone were very close to one another.  The Fossil Q Grant Gen 2 was horrrriiiiiiibleeee.  Its not even close.  I would walk 3 miles and the Fossil q would be off more than a mile(2000 +steps).  I worked with Fossil to exchange the watch because no way the watch could be that far off.  Once I received the replacement I still saw the huge discrepancy in step calculation.  Text notifications and linking the watch to the phone to control your music on the IPhone work great.  I cant say how disappointed I was with the Fitness Tracker portion though, VERY POOR JOB.

My husband loves this watch! It's very sexy and fits his style perfectly. He wears it to the gym to track his steps, but it also looks great when he dresses up for work. It is such an attractive watch and you can't even tell it's a smart watch.

Purchased this watch in February. Immediately noticed that the step count was inaccurate. Wore the watch and my wife's Fitbit blaze for a walk (on the same arm) and the difference in steps was incredible. This watch only logged about 2500 steps to the blaze's more accurate 6500 steps. (Distance confirmed via GPS and driving the route.)

Additionally, shortly after the "support window" had closed, the glass bezel broke. A huge crack right through the center of the dial. I have had a lot of watches from many different brands and I have NEVER cracked the bezel before, even with much rougher wear and over longer periods of time. Now I'm stuck with a broken watch that doesn't log my activity properly.

Pros: Bluetooth notifications work, especially handy when I walk away from my phone, I know when I've missed a call or text.
  Stylish, minus the cracked bezel

Cons: step count is inaccurate
  Bezel inexplicably cracked after 2.5 months of occasional, daytime wear
  Return/warranty period too short

Overall, I'm disappointed with this purchase and would NOT recommend this watch.

I decided to buy this watch because, like everyone else, I had a smart watch and I was sick and tired of charging it every single day. So I came across the concept of a "hybrid watch" here.

Pros:
*Looks and feels like a real fossil watch, not a silly gadget
*The pedometer seems to be pretty accurate (until your battery gets low - see cons)
*The app is very detailed about the types of steps and sleeps you get
*You can set multiple app notifications to a single digit alert (I have Messenger, Text, and WhatsApp all on 1 for example)
*YOU DO NOT NEED TO CHARGE THE THING AT ALL!!! (I literally only take my watch off to shower)

Cons:
*No illuminating watch hands - this is the biggest gripe honestly. The watch has a naturally dark background, so if you are in a poor lit or even dark room, you will not be seeing anything on this watch.
*The App regularly crashes the first time I load it (Samsung Note 9), but works fine after loading it again.
*There is no clear indication when to replace the battery. I went 7 months before replacing mine, however about 5 months in my pedometer went nuts and started registering an insane amount of steps. No other issues with the watch whatsoever. I finally decided to replace the battery issue and the pedometer is back to normal again. So I guess the crazy pedometer registers is your best indication to swap out that battery.

Summary:
Overall, I love the watch simply because I do not care for charging of smart watches at all when all I like are the notifications and pedometer, which these hybrid watches have without the need to regularly charge them.

I would definitely recommend a hybrid watch to anyone that does not need all the extra bells and whistles on their wrist, but still would like those added amenities mentioned above.

The quality is better than expected.

The metal nor the quartz glass gets scratched easily. I wear this daily and even when i sleep. Not one scratch on the watch face at all. I only have one ding due to hitting something metal with my hand. But even then it's tiny and hardly noticable.

It's a perfect blend of a classic watch with smart watch capabilities. This is exactly what i have been wanting.

The battery is easily replaced and lasts quite a while actually. The bands were easy to fit to my wrist (you need a watch repair kit for this).

The watch face is easy to read and can be calibrated for precision.

Overall a great watch, i was skeptical having had a couple smart watches before. But this is the perfect blend i was looking for and needed. Minimalist smart watch with a beautiful watch face.

Got this for my husband for Christmas.  Paid $175.00!!!  I ordered on 11/27/17 to make sure I got it in time for Christmas.  It quit working last week (2/12/18).  Went online to see about a return and was told the return dates had closed effective 1/31/18.  What kind of return policy is only 60 days?!  I am extremely annoyed!!!!  For $175.00 it should have worked more than 6 weeks!!!

Love the quality. Clean sleek and nice weight with adjustable linkage band.  More features than expected.  Has smart watch capabilities  WITHOUT  the cheesey plastic band that most have... Those  seem gross and rather grade-schoolesk in my opinion and that coupled with  square primitive digital readout looked like smart watches for dummies and why I haven't been inclined to consider a smart watch until this .  Others commonly look generic and are simply  a dime a dozen.  This watch stands far outside of any smartwatch I've encountered. I collect regular Fossil watches this one will be the star that never sees the inside of the watch box on my dresser. Self charging! That's amazing.. Like we need another device to charge. Fossil hybrid offering the style and luxury and the look and feel that others lacked all the while integrating the technology capabilities that are almost required of our accessories in this ever advancing "smart"  device  modern world.
This watch and its unique style and intricate gears shown in the face are eye catching.  It looks more expensive than it was. This is a great gift for a gadget loving guy who has everything. Just got it so learning the features will update later. Very pleased so far.

product_description: Live a stronger smarter life with Galaxy Watch at your wrist rest well and stay active with built in health tracking and a Bluetooth connection that keeps everything at your wrist Plus go for days without charging Go nonstop for days on a single charge The wireless charger lets you power up without slowing down Average expected performance based on typical use Results may vary Battery type and size 270mAh Available in 2 sizes and 3 colors the Galaxy Watch offers stylish watch faces so realistic they hardly look digital Plus choose from a collection of interchangeable bands Pairs with both Android and iOS smartphones via Bluetooth connection Compatible Devices Samsung Smartphone Non Samsung Android Smartphone Android OS 5 0 and above RAM 1 5GB and above iOS 9 0 and above iPhone 5 and above Included in box Galaxy Watch Additional Strap Large and Small included Wireless charging Dock Travel Adaptor Quick Start Guide User Manual Warranty 1 Year Standard Parts and Labor OS Tizen 4 0 Note Kindly refer user manual before use

reviews.review_body: I just bought this watch to see if I would like it enough to get a data plan and use it when my phone was not in range. Thought it would be convenient to have it notify me of a caller when I'm walking the dog and may not want to stop to get the phone out of my pocket. Very glad I didn't go all out. It syncs to my phone just fine, but the advertised battery life must be when it is in power saving mode and who wants that all the time. I maybe get half a day and the power is so low that it gives me a notice to put in power saving mode. I followed the directions by charging completely before using for the first time, too. It's a nice watch but I could have just kept using my Fitbit.

I've been using the watch for some time now and it's been great so far! The messaging, notifications, voice system, and multiple functions have all met my expectations. The battery life is great as well with light usage such as notifications and reminders.  It definitely rivals the Apple watch and other competitors.  So for I haven't had any issues with it and it's been worked flawlessly.  I'd definitely consider purchasing it if you're into the smartwatch market!

Great little watch for the price cant wait for a new model to come out. It always said I was sleeping after laying down to long, I love how you can change features and update from your phone as well and great features so far.

Just so you know...the seller advertises this as a "US Warranty version" that is not the case...I went to the Samsung web site to register my watch and it wouldn't recognize the serial #...so I got on the phone w/ Samsung customer service...they found the serial # in their system...BUT it was manufactured in South America, therefore NO warranty...the writing on the outside of the box is in Spanish...just BEWARE...also there were 2 other UPC stickers w/ serial #'s over the original...if you don't care about a warranty...carry-on...if you do...buy elsewhere...it's still a very good watch...works mostly great...which is why I gave 5 stars...

Having used a pebble time steel for most of 2016 up till the time of me writing this review it's a nice upgrade. Battery is no where near as good as the time steel but that's to be expected considering the plethora of features this watch has.
My only real complaint here is the fact that if you wear it daily, expect the bezel to scratch and scuff fairly easily which has unfortunately already happened to mine.
In order to remedy this I went and bought a protective silicone/rubber protective case from Spigen and hopefully it'll do the job.

Wow that is all i can say, it works wonders, when I have it set to a classic watch face people think its a real geared watch, they cannot tell the difference, then i switch it to something like my cat's picture and it blows them away. Its great

This is a replacement/upgrade from GearFit 2.  No blemishes were found during unboxing.  Excellent display quality.  The size and weight is comparable to a dive watch, even a bit smaller than a Casio Tough Solar on the wrist.  Sleep tracking has more detail, 4 stages vs 3.  There are TONS of watch faces available the Galaxy store.  The price made me happy.  Battery life in the first week is acceptable, even better in airplane mode.  I'm finding it better to use the auto workout tracking for better battery life but that sacrifices heart rate data.  I'll update with pics  and more performance info.

Love my Galaxy!  Worked great out of the box and very easy to set up.  Love the spinning face dial to select apps.  Goes 2 to 3 days on a charge, but also charges quickly (within a couple of hours when fully drained).  Love the variety of available watch faces for free, and tons more if you want to buy them.  Wasn't sure how the phone app would work, but it works surprisingly well.  It's a great hands-free feature when driving or working with both hands.  Sound quality is good, too.  Also like the larger face diameter, which is nice for us older guys.  Great, great watch!!

Overall, I really like this watch. It looks and operates good. The apps available cover the entire spectrum of functions. From sleep to exercise to clock functions, it's very user friendly. when I first got it, I had a Motorola phone and that pairing didn't work well. The phone was several years later and didn't support some of the newer features. I was ready for a new phone anyway so got a Samsung phone; the combination is great. I would suggest that anyone in the market for a smart watch should put this one in their consideration list.

I like the functions, but I wish it were a little lower profile. I have a Galaxy phone, so it made sense to also get a Galaxy watch, but I prefer the lines of the Apple watch. I wish there was a more streamlined option in the Galaxy family (yes, I know there's the active watch, but it's got a larger face, which is also a turn off for me). Otherwise I'm happy with it.

I was looking for a less expensive watch after my last one was destroyed in a motorcycle accident. I know this is not the newest model but i love it. the features give me what i need. I am sure the newer ones are sooo much better but i don't need the latest and greatest. This one does everything i need and all i want.

I've had the watch for some months now. To be fair to Samsung I bought this watch mostly as a sports watch, not a smart-watch, but I'm disappointed either way. It's simply a massively underwhelming sports watch. Once or twice it didn't even keep the activity I did and saved. The heart-rate monitor is terrible, but most wrist-measuring watches are, so I can't complain too much about that. The watch itself, despite being tight on my wrist, wobbles about when I am mountain biking and actually hurts me. Samsung's own Health app is useless.  I had a Garmin before which has a whole massively detailed online portal where you can see everything you've done and overlay it with Google Maps etc. Samsung has no online portal at all and looking at it on your phone is basic at best. Despite all the reviews it's not all that easy to use as a smart watch.  It's too small for starters.  Samsung's original smart watch was much better looking IMO and square, which makes sense.  Round may look better in some devices, but is totally stupid and impractical for a smart watch. The dial on the front works well most of the time to move between screens, but if that's the way to measure a smart watch then it's just sad. I've yet to see a smart watch with any real use.  Better to get a sports watch which has some rudimentary smart features than a smart watch with some rudimentary sports features.  Complete waste of money

This watch has to be the best watch on the android side of things.  The battery last almost 2 days for me, and does a great job tracking my fitness. I'm a runner, so this feature is a must! I really like the round, turntable bezel, which makes for great user interface. It does include a heartrate monitor, and a sleep monitoring feature that's very useful.

I'm using a Samsung phone, so the synchronization seems very seamless. It comes with a rubber watch band right out of the box, this is great for active folks. The watch rubber band is stylish, so I didn't have a need to replace it for another one. Great buy for any android user looking for a smartwatch that works well with android.

This is not Android Wear. It's Samsung's Tizen.
As my 4th smart watch, and as a Technology Pro, I hoped I would be able to adapt Tizen to my needs. This was not the case, and I ended up returning it - a process Amazon made very painless.
CONS:
-No Google Maps integration that I could get working, whatsoever, even after attempting several Samsung apps.
-No 'OK Google' at all - instead I have the dreaded Bixby. Not even close. You're fired, Bixby.
-Samsung Account needed for nearly any app, or major feature - including watch faces.
-Samsung's store has very limited selections compared to Android Wear.
-Lack of flexibility: Requires Samsung apps be used as default apps on  your phone to sync to the watch, like Messaging, Samsung Mail app for calendars, and more. Nope, Nope, Nope!
-NFC Payments requires use of Samsung Pay, and a Samsung account to track my history. NOPE!
-No Google Fit - Requires 'Samsung Health', and a Samsung account.
-Price is stratospheric for a device locked into crap software.

PROS:
- Hardware was light, dial was smooth, screen was nice.

Essentially, this watch is a marketing angle to get you into bed with Samsung account related software. Period.

The Samsung Suite of software lacks flexibility, even at the watch-face level the selections were disappointing. The amount of free software is incredibly limited, and the pay software for the Tizen OS is minimal and under-developed compared to Android Wear.

I returned it and decided to wear an older Android Wear device instead.

Do not buy this watch from the seller called "Globus Projects Ltd" if you are looking for a US version, since their products are not as described and they appear to be sending out international versions with stickers on the box claiming to be the US version. Watch arrived with packaging in a foreign language. Unable to use Samsung Pay on this watch, which is not a deal breaker for me. Otherwise the watch works great so far. Battery life is excellent. Very easy to connect to phone and set up, even though the default language was also set to a foreign language. Easy to read notifications and respond to messages with brief replies. Works well for controlling music playing on phone. Would definitely recommend this smartwatch, especially to use with a Samsung phone.

I purchased this device eight months ago and was happy for the first couple months. About two months in, I had to send the watch in for service when the accelerometer seemingly went out as sleep data was no longer being recorded (The factory resets and software updates were in vain). From a consumer standpoint, I don't think the quality is really there with the money you have to spend on a watch like this. I just can't say the hardware was properly designed with the problems I've been experiencing.

Now, just a few months later, I'm having to send the device in again since the battery won't last longer than 8 hours on "low-power mode." Why should I be acting as a Beta tester when this watch is already in production!? After sleuthing the message boards, I found multiple complaints from other customers with the same device. All Samsung had been responding with was "turn off the features [you paid for] to increase the battery life." Very helpful, Samsung. You guys really know how to make a customer feel valued.

When I purchased this watch I was expecting a complete product and better performance for the money I spent. Strangely enough, Samsung's return policy is not longer than about a month. Funny how things have a tendency to fall apart after the warranty expires. Now I realize I shouldn't expect much out of Samsung's wearables ¯\_(?)_/¯. If I ever do go with another smart watch, I'll be steering clear of anything Samsung. Buyer beware.

I love this watch. I've had it for a few days now. Replaced my fitbits because I'm tired of them dying in under a year all the time. Battery life sucks compared to Fitbit, but I get why. I will have to charge every other day instead of twice a week now. Annoying but not a big deal really. And their app gets 1 star because it sucks. It helps you do some settings, but you can't see fitness tracking info like you can on Fitbit. That is where Fitbit wins, their app is exponentially better.

You cannot go wrong with this watch if you have a Samsung phone (im sure it's compatible with other phones but to use features best it works amazing with my Note 9). This is the bluetooth version. I can reply to texts, answer calls and even use it to talk. This is the 42mm and not going to lie, i have big hands and this watch still looks good on my wrist. I get many compliments on how nice the watch looks. I wear it to business meetings and many people glance at it and have had someone tell me it looks real elegant. My first watch was a TicWatch E which was a great first smartwatch but had to upgrade to this one. It is not laggy and very responsive. Would highly recommend.

I main bought so I could use the GolfPad App on a watch, and it works amazing I absolutly love using it out on the course.  It is also very comfortable, battery last about as long as you would expect a smart watch to run (about 2 days unless your tickering with it alot then about a day), i just put it on the charger every day after work and its never dead.  Only complain i have it that if you have tattoos on your wrist the heart rate monitor isnt going to work threw your tattoos.

I have been wearing this watch almost everyday since i bought it. Not a single scratch on the screen. There are a few dents on the metal itself, but that is bound to happen. It would look better with the metal clasp for more formal occasions. It is waterproof which i tested by swimming in a pool and a lake. If you are swimming in chlorine, definitely make sure to wash that shit out or it will crust up on the band and clog up the speakers. Overall, great smart watch for the price!

I very much like this watch. It has all the functions I wanted and some. I came from a Fitbit Versa 2 and compared to that this Samsung blows that watch out of the water.  It is much easier to change watch faces on the Samsung. It is appealing to the eye and flows well with my style. I would recommend this watch to anyone with an Android-based phone. I understand this watch even works with an iPhone though I cannot verify that since I do not own one. Once again I am very pleased with this purchase and will recommend to friends.

This was my first smartwatch so maybe there are better alternatives out there, but for me this watch greatly exceeded my expectations. I really got it to help with time tracking and notifications becasue I never have my phone on my person. But the activity tracking, sleep tracker, and even having the weather right there are great. Also the heart rate monitor and tracking hikes or long walks is excellent. There are so many great looking free watch faces that there isn't really a need to purchase.
Battery is two days with moderate to heavy usage. Three easily if you turn off the constant heart rate monitor.

Easily syncs with any app you choose. It defaults to Samsung apps but all you need to do is turn on notification for Google calendar and it will automatically show notifications on your watch.

I love almost everything about this smartwatch, it's amazing. Especially the battery life, I get 3 days of constant use easily.  My only complaint is the bezel, it seems from the first few days I've owned it till now just a few weeks in, that it has a grinding noise like something is stuck under the bezel and makes it hard to rotate at times.  I wonder if a small hair or something has made it's way in there.  It's very very frustrating that this can happen at all let alone so soon from me owning it. Running it under water helps to solve this but it's only temporary as it seems to come back over time.

First of all, I am in the Android/Samsung camp when it comes to phones.  This watch is a really nice complement to this experience.  The round face and rotating bezel are the looks I like in a watch.  Personally I don't like square watches.  The rotating bezel works flawlessly and makes navigating the watch fairly intuitive.

The watch is comfortable to wear all day and night.  I only take it off to charge every two days.  Yes the battery lasts more than two days.

The best features are notifications work great and easily customized.  I use it for fitness tracking.  Starting and stopping workouts are intuitive.  I noticed the heart rate sensing is just as accurate as my chest strap.

Overall I am pleasantly surprised how much I like this watch.

My husband and I got matching watches and WE LOVE THEM! I mainly use mine to listen to music at work and converse on the phone discretely. I use the step counter as well as the heart rate monitor to keep track of my stress. They even have a breathing app to help if your stress levels are high. This watch has so many features that we both appreciate like the step counter as well as the ability to reply to and read text messages as well as talk on my phone right from the watch! The charging stand is also a great addition. There is almost nothing my phone can do that this watch can not.. we absolutely love it!

This is a good smart watch for first time users transitioning from traditional wristwatches. It has the look of a fashion watch. The rotating bezel is great and one of a kind and allows you to navigate the watch with touching the screen. One downside I encountered was that after a year of use, the sensor became loose and didn't stay in place. This caused the watch to think I wasn't wearing it, so it kept locking me out and was no longer usable.

This is my 3rd smartwatch and seems to be just what I was looking for. Tracks my heart beat really well, way better than my previous two models. Love the notification feature for emails and text messages and the ability to respond on the watch. This is the bluetooth version so it cant perform the "number share" with your cell phone. Battery life is about 2 days max, wish it was better. I usually charge mine at night so dont use the sleep monitoring part of it. Tried charging it when in the shower but it doesnt charge fast enough in 30 minutes. I use it mainly for pulse monitoring and fitness tracking.

A little under 3 years of use and the back cover for the heartbeat sensor has come off from normal use. I've never swam with it or anything like that. I feel it should last much longer when I paid $260 for it. Mobile app is buggy as well but I dealt with it because as a watch it worked great.

I shopped around everywhere before I made a purchase because I wanted to Compare Quality and pricing. I looked at Best Buy Walmart Target an Amazon. Amazon had the best deal and the best quality! I am so happy that I went ahead and made this purchase through Amazon! It arrived before it was expected which I was very pleased with. All of the functions are wonderful I can talk text look at my calendar and my contacts and check my social media messages all on my wrist. I would highly recommend you purchase one of these if you are a busy person like I am it makes my life alot easy to not be pulling out my phone while at work or on the go! It fits perfectly and I also purchased interchangeable bands so that u can change my style when I get the urge.

The Samsung Galaxy watch 42mm is a great watch for fitness and style. It works pretty good at tracking actual physical movement so the readings are on point. The apps are easy to use and for the most part customizable in arranging apps to your preferences. I not a fan of all the options for faces it has but it gives you a basic four, you change colors and small details. The battery life would be the my biggest complain on this watch, it lasts about 2 days sometimes a day and half depending on the use. Also the rim of the watch is easily scratch, so if you're job involves a lot of moving or hands on I would take it in consideration.

I had my eye on this for a while. Its presentation is nice and the build quality is top notch.
I own an iPhone and the watch certainly works with the iPhone but in a limited capacity. The Galaxy app offers very limited accessibility to features on the phone where the app on a Samsung device offers much much more.
The App Store is a hot mess. While searching directly for a particular app the App Store would fail to find it, however that same app could be found by scrolling through the App Store.
WiFi connectivity is shoddy at best. The Auto WiFi feature would never switch from a Bluetooth connection to WiFi, you have to completely disable Bluetooth on your phone to force the watch to connect to WiFi (for faster downloads).
When you turned Bluetooth back on, the watch would not connect again without you disabling the auto WiFi connection.
Another huge disappointment is that Samsung Galaxy only works within its own ecosystem- exactly what Apple products tend to do. You cannot control your Google Home through this watch. You can use Google Assistant to control SmartThings, but no google devices are available to connect to SmartThings.
This product has so much potential but fails to live up to it.

Forget the original review.  This watch has, over time, been extraordinarily unreliable.  At least once a week it drains in only a few hours, and gets very hot.  Something is running in the background and I can't find out what.  I have made no tweaks to the watch other than changing the face.  Lately it has gone one step further.  It loses its face, loses its settings, will not reconnect to the phone, basically requires a power down and back up.  That does fix it, IF you can get the power down icon to work -- and it doesn't always work.  But by then it is down to 40% charge so you can't finish the day with it.  I have searched all tech documents for solutions and have found none.  Finally, today, when I could not even see the time on the thing, I removed the special steel mesh band I put on (which is very nice) and did another reboot of the watch.  With my 16 ounce claw hammer.  I'll say this -- I could only smash the crystal.  The case survived all my attempts to reboot it.  But, it is now thoroughly dead and in the bottom of the trash can.  This is not the first watch I have linked to the Galaxy phone.  Every other one had issues as well.  I don't think Samsung phones, and I like them, have got the techie stuff worked out yet for dealing with watches.  As much as I loathe and despise Apple products (I am a retired I.T. Director and software engineer, BTW) I have to admit that my wife's Apple watch and her iPhone do work together.  But I will go back to my nice Bulova quartz watch.  At least I'll be able to see the frickin' time!  My attempts to have a Dick Tracy watch are over.  This watch should get zero stars.

Bought the watch for my husband and we noticed upon opening the box that the outside was in spanish. Watch is fine, perfect condition but when uploading all the information we noticed that it did not have Samsung pay. A small minor thing that you can go without. Well I took the risk and sent it back to order another one to see if it was specifically that watch or if they all came that way. 2nd watch came in same thing. International version with a spanish box and no Samsung pay. Finally gave up and accepted fate with the watch, a couple of days later Samsung pay pops up. Watch hasn’t given him any issues since purchase.

I have been using this watch for a week and I love the features. The 42mm size is perfect for my wrists and it doesn't look like a smart watch because it is not real bulky. Even the smaller size it still is easy to read. It works great with my Samsung S9 smart phone and the Samsung wear app on my phone makes setting up and changing settings through the phone very easy. Battery life seems to be fine, used it a lot yesterday and when I took it off last night to charge it was only down to 65%, so it should work fine for at least two days. The only negative is the silicon band that comes with the watch is OK for sport use but I wanted a better looking band so I purchased a leather band for $15 on Amazon that looks great and fit perfect.

...definitely consider this one!  I got the smaller model (42mm) on sale.
That being said, the sale price does not sway my review in the least.
I've used this daily for over 3 months and I absolutely love this thing.  I've owned 1 other smartwatch in the past, but it was too far removed from this current generation to compare.

The display is plenty bright.  The battery life is 2 days or more.  Side note:  The display settings will need to be adjusted; brightness and auto-off.

Accuracy of steps is top-tier.  The GPS location works within < 5m in my testing.
There is a whole array of workouts that can be selected.  You can even select an intensity for some and it will adjust accordingly if you decide you want to go HAM on your workout.  Highly recommended!

I love this watch,I use mainly to control my headphones volume,getting notifications while in class is quite handy. I dont really use the fitness apps since I find that it drains the battery too much for my liking. Overall I think its more of a utility watch than a smart watch, the only thing thats really holding it back is the battery life, its adequate but goes down really fast if fidget with it too much I.e watching a quick how to youtube video on it but as a watch that has a few tricks up its sleeve its a 5/5 for me.Physically the watch is quite heavy which is a good thing since makes it feel sturdy, appearance wise it looks better on the pictures tbh,I guess I just need some aftermarket straps and bezels to spruce it up.

This smartwatch is by far the best I have ever used, I have the galaxy s9 and this works perfectly with it. The heart rate is accurate, the battery is great even though I got the 42mm version it could last me 2-3 days, it looks great, and you can customize it any way you want, it is extremely durable and is much better than i thought it was.  And a tip, if the bezel looks scratched take a wet rag and wipe it and it will most likely go away and look new again. Another tip, if it starts to be slow and lag quite a bit then just hold the home button and turn it off.  I wear this watch every day and use it all the time, and I still get compliments from people about it.  If your thinking about getting this watch, GET IT it is worth the money.

I resisted buying a smart watch for a long time. But when I saw the features on this watch, I decided to give it a try. Glad I did! The watch allows me to see who is emailing and texting me, so that I don't have to pull out my phone.  I can also text simple replies. If in blue tooth range, you can talk on the phone with it too. That happened to me the other day. I was in the backyard and had forgotten to bring my phone. Because of the watch, I didn't miss an important call. I like the watch face I use because it has the date, time, temperature, and battery life remaining. I would say the battery has 2 days, max, before needing recharging. It has a feature that puts it to sleep at night so the incoming texts and emails don't interfere with sleep. I am most pleased.

I got one about a year ago and loved it so much that I got him one, too. He's all tech crazy so I knew he'd like it and he does. I am not tech crazy but my kids and I love how I never miss their messages or calls any longer. It's really easy to use and does like everything imaginable. I can actually answer the phone using my watch! I'm like Dick Tracy or something. It knows when I'm doing some fitness thing and tracks me and tells me how I'm doing. I don't wear it to bed because I don't care about how I'm sleeping. It charges nicely and it lasts all day. It's kind of pretty but even if it's not elegant-looking, it's cool. So I'm cool now.

If you haven't bought one of these watches yet, you better get on it! This watch is very useful, reliable, classy and worth every penny! And for this like New Used version for $60? It's a no brainer! Very happy with this purchase. Came looking new and flawless, charger, charging cord and a hang on watch charger. If you haven't bought one yet after reading this you are trippn lol ?? ?? ??
La bateria no dura mucho, Maximo dos dias.

Lets be honest, those reviews you see on youtube do not apply to everyone. I use this watch to see and reply to short texts to my friends and group chat the battery life is great for one day then i take it off before i sleep and charge it or you can sleep with it. But only do that if you can spare 2-3hrs before you head out again so it can charge up but tbh i don't need to track my sleep. Its simple its easy but i do wish i had a watch face that showed 24hr format and was also analog for astetics but i digress for what it can do its grest but i do think the bigger watch face is better cuz it is kinda small but its still nice

Since I have other Samsung devices that I love, it was only logical to get the Samsung Watch.  Mine is not the one with Lte access.  The enhanced Health apps are great; steps, exorcise, heart, diet, and running can be tracked and managed. There are many other apps and widgets available to add to you watch that connect with your phone via Bluetooth including the standards: calls, calendar, weather, and many many more.  It does require that you keep your phone within BT range for some functions.

I strongly recommend this watch for anyone with Samsung or android phones.  It does have an apple function but I don't know how that works.

The watch works perfectly. I would give it a 5 star rating but the charger that comes with it is junk. It lights up but never charges the watch. Have to share a charger with my wife until I find a new one I like.

I bought this after getting a cheap $40 smart watch just to see if I needed all those extra services a smart watch can provide. I've owned fitbit charge 2 and 3 for several years before deciding to switch to a smart watch. The convenience of being able to ping your phone to locate it was what really hooked me. After a couple weeks of owning the product I had to get a good smart watch, and I really love all the features of the Galaxy Watch.

One big complaint though, is after several years of owning different watches with all kinds of different bands, the band this watch originally came with gave me welt like sores on my wrists. I tried switching hands, loosening the band, moving it up and down on my wrist, but after wearing it in place for more than an hour, my sking begins to burn.

First two photos attached is my left hand, a couple hours after removing the band after wearing it for one work shift (the welt on the first pic originally had yellow in the middle) third photo is a couple weeks after I switched hands, the skin is dry and flakey.

Again, I've had multiple different watches of varying brilliance, with multiple different rubber bands, and this is the first time I've had a reaction this severe.

When I saw the smaller size, I thought "Oh, this is the same size as the Gear S2 classic", which also has a 42mm screen. Unfortunately, the outer ring is larger, and more importantly, the watch is around 30% thicker. As a guy with small wrists, this thing looks huge on my wrist, and I'd especially prefer if it were thinner. Make it 40% thinner and less bezel and I'd upgrade immediately.

The battery life does seem to be better, perhaps by around 30%. That's definitely something to consider upgrading for. The rest of the features are mostly the same in terms of things I care about, although I'm still poking around. But most likely I'm going to end up returning this and keeping my Gear S2 classic for a little while longer.

It does everything I would ask it to. The apps are simple, easy and complete. The processing does well and the ease of access is on point. My only complaints are that the battery doesn't last long. It is doing a lot of things and I can imagine it's hard to make a battery this small that will last, but it lasts 2-3 days if I don't use it much and 1-2 if i am actively using it. That and the Alti-Barometer doesn't always seem accurate. Not the biggest issue but those two are why it's 4 stars and not 5. Great watch!

The watch is a little bigger than expected. After wearing all day today, I am getting used to it.  So far, I am pleased with my purchase. I believe I will replace the existing "rubber" watch band with one of the after market fashion watch bands so that i can make the watch look a little more "feminine" and a little less "sporty".  Overall, i am still pleased with my purchase and would recommend this to others.

I can't comment on Battery Life or Durability yet since i just got the watch yesterday.  I can say that it is very easy to set up and use. I also like the way the bands attach to the watch. I had a Gear Fit2.  The bands were continuously coming off.  This is why i upgraded to this watch. I don't think i will have that problem with this watch.

What can I say, I love my Samsung Galaxy SMartwatch.  The watch lasts me approximately 3-4 days before needing to be charged.  The apps are fine for what I need and use.  To be fair though the Android Wear is supposed to have more apps.  I love the twisty bezel to navigate all the functions.  It is one of the reasons I bought this version instead of the Galaxy Active.  It has all the fitness tracking I needs.  The voice recognition works very well for me as well.  I can narrate a text to someone pretty easily.  The one thing I haven't tried yet is the handwriting recognition.  It looks a bit difficult.  Be aware the screen is decent for a watch, but it can be hard to use the touchscreen, because of the size.  Especially if you have big old sausage fingers.  But that is where the twisting bezel comes in so handy.

But won't work with 3rd party apps like K9 mail and Chomp SMS. I hate the samsung factory installed apps, took an eternity to get it to receive notifications from 3rd party apps, after changing setting after setting I gave up, and then 2 days later it started to receive notifications from these apps, all on it's own. You can't go thru the archives if you miss the 3 second time window when the notificaiton pops up. The reply options are limited too, editing them is a royal PITA. It does control Pandora, which is one of the main reasons I bought it. The WiFi feature sucks battery life, so I just turned it off. All in all, better than the apple watches my friends have, but not exactly ideal. Needs work, hopefully they will push out an update soon

I've tried several watches.  I was about done and would have gone back to my old reliable Gear S1.  Well, I picked this one up and I am so happy with it.  I do use a lot of apps, change watch faces a lot, have alerts, incoming outgoing calls, text messages.  The battery lasts 1 1/2 days.  Again, I make it work.  I had a problem received my calls.  Did everything I knew.  A friend suggested we go to Best Buy and talk to the Samsung people.  Well, he figured it out.  I had the Blacklist on my phone and it was blocking all incoming calls.  Its works great.  When my phone is in the other room I can talk on my watch.  And I have the Bluetooth  version. It works perfectly with my LG Stylo 3 plus.  I highly recommend it. And its great that this is the latest and greatest.  So happy with this.  Thank you Samsung.

The Galaxy watch is really good. It's got great battery life, pretty good workout tracking, it's easy to use, has a beautiful screen, and it's fairly quick. However sometimes, and very rarely it slows down. Also, the bezel scratches very easily. After a week of use, (and I'm not very active and I don't use it while working on something) it's already obtained a few scratches. Some scratches buff out after a few rubs. Even though they're small it still bugs me. Otherwise the Galaxy watch is great. It has amazing battery life and that's one of the biggest highlights. If you need a good smartwatch with good battery life, get this watch. However if you are more clumsy or do a lot of hard physical work I would not recommend it to much, but you can always get protection. But in the end you should decide on what your lifestyle is and make your choice.

As soon as the note 10 was out I ditched my Apple phone.. Completely forgetting about how much I relied on my Apple watch. I kept it and went without what I needed bc the biggest thing I needed was HR since I have SVT.. Well I see a good deal and order a Fitbit health thinking I'm going to get everything I need, Only to realize it was a complete down grade from my Apple watch.. Until I came across this bad boy!!  I ordered all black, it arrived quickly, Bluetooth together beautifully and in
 no time I already downloaded what I needed and was able to answer calls/txt/emails without needing to carry my phone.. Being a mom of three special needs kiddos I'm constantly on the go and don't always have time to stop and check my phone!! This watch is it! If your like me and you switched from apple to Samsung, This is the equivalent to the apple watch!! You will love it hands down!! ????

I prefer the Galaxy Watch over my older Gear S3 because in the 42mm size it fits better on my wrist and I can wear it all day instead of just when working out.  The battery life easily lasts me a full day with about 40-50% to spare.  The rotating dial makes navigating the watch way easier and more intuitive to use than Wear OS watches.

Unfortunately, despite years of complaints on various internet forums Samsung watches still lack basic podcast functionality.  There is still no TIzen app with native support for downloading podcasts directly to the watch.  Spotify comes closest and lets you download music onto the watch but not podcasts for some reason.  Instead in order to listen to podcasts while working out without your phone you have to go through a convoluted workaround which involves saving podcasts to the music folder of your phone then manually copying files on your phone or restarting your phone in order to get the Galaxy Wearable app to see new files that can then be transferred.  You also have to use an app like Pocketcasts which has an option to save podcasts in a format other apps can read.

If you have an Android phone Samsung watches are still significantly better than Wear OS in terms of design and ease of use, but still held back by the lack of apps for Tizen and Samsung refusing for some reason to fill the gaps in the basic functionality they lack by making their own apps.

I wore the Gear S2 for a couple of years and liked it but it had its drawbacks. First, the smaller bezel make it harder to navigate, second was the fact that it did not have the 'always on' option which I really like on this version so I can always see what time it is without needing to do any type of wrist movement.  Okay, so what I like about this watch are the following:
1) Its waterproof,  Yay!!  I was always scared of getting the S2 wet and having it die on me.
2) Larger bezel screen to make navigating easier
3) The battery seems to last longer, however since I have the Dislay options on high its hard to notice so far, but I think it will last at least 8-9 hours more than the S2.
4) The whole case and appearance make it look more durable and resistable to damage.

Good work Samsung!
THS ITEM IS EVEN BETTER THAN I THOUGHT. IT CAN DO SO MUCH AND HAS SO MANY FREE WATCH FACES THAT LOOOK REAL COOL. BATTERY LIFE IS NOT TOO BAD

First, to set up a Samsung account has taken over an hour of typing the same thing in over and over again. And it's always wrong. Worse than Apple! (which is bad about want pw every 3 clicks). It still doesn't come up right after I discovered that my phone was substituting a French accented character for a capital C and all other caps in the pw. Not Samsung's fault. BUT no way to visualize what the pw you've just typed was actually seen as.

Second, The temperature setting seems locked in to °C. So 21°C is what I see on the watch face I picked. Have not found a way to change this to °F, and have it stick. Several way to supposedly change it, but none stick.

Third, I want the face to go off after 10 seconds or so and then wake up when I twist my wrist or move my arm. I do no want to have to use my other hand to tap something. I keep making the change, but it doesn't stick...possibly a result of the password crap mentioned above.

At this point I'm 1) kinda liking the thing. 2) Almost ready to take a ball pein hammer to it and toss it in the junk pile. and 3) why can't Samsung get the software right? Damn. My Samsung microwave works, so does my Samsung laundry set and my Samsung refrigerator.

Not only that, but this is obviously an old (obsolete) version of the device what does it have us installing software for newer devices that crash before they complete (yes!).

Grrr!

I like the watch, but not enough to have it be my sole watch for my new Android phone. The sleep tracking is not good, and I have tried tightening the watch one notch past where it is comfortable on my wrist. It sometimes thinks I am asleep while I am watching TV, and sometimes thinks I am awake for an hour in the middle of the night when I am asleep. The watchband is not large. My wrists are not large and I am on the 3rd-to-last notch. But it feels comfortable. I am ambivalent about Tyzen, but apparently it is better than WearOS. I'm coming from having an iPhone and an Apple Watch. It is not on par with an Apple Watch, but reviews say that no Android Watch is. So, it does it's job fine, except for the sleep tracking. On the plus side, it looks good, the GPS and step-tracking is great, battery lasts longer than I expected after reading reviews, and it's lightweight.

I bought this because I wanted  a smartwatch to track my steps, sleep and just in general to view incoming texts and stuff. That part it handled well, although the heart rate monitering could be better. Durability wise its amazing!! Buttons are clicky, strap is good, and you could always buy a screen protector for a few bucks if youre scared of scratching it. Although the rotating bezel has gotten loose a bit and Lowkey see that as an issue the more I use it down the line.. OS is very good if you use a samsung, although the app selection is very poor, I hope it gets better. Google maps isnt available and if you want use gps you have to buy an app and install it on your phone aswell. Theres spotify, tidal and stuff but basically it. Battery is amazing, im getting 1.5 to 2 days without a charge. If the OS was improved and the bezel didnt get loose after aome time it definitely would be the best smartwatch

I waited for months for this watch expecting something to actually compete with iwatch on fitness and smart watch capabilities.  Nope.  The main reason I would wear this over a nice analog watch is for fitness.  Its heart rate monitoring is terrible.  I have it set to constant auto monitoring but it only does it when I'm not moving, about once an hour at best.  It never works when I'm actually moving or exercising.  When I attempt to do a force measure when working out it gives an error every time about clean sensor.  If I'm sweating at all it will not work, kinda defeats the purpose. My ancient fitbit HR did 10x better on heart monitoring and it knew when I was working out even without logging it. This galaxy watch doesn't even know when I try to log it.  It just uses my heart rate from earlier in day and thinks I've done a few steps. I've tried everything short of shaving my arm hair to improve it.  I'm throwing in the towel.  It's pointless as a fitness watch, especially if you are doing any calorie counting like myfitnesspal.

It's a decent smart watch but lacks a way to type using hand drawn characters like iwatch, so unless a canned response works or you can use voice, you can't respond on watch.

The battery life is no where near what is advertised. I have to charge mine daily.  The only thing it does amazingly well is track sleep but if you wear it at night it will not last but a day on power.

It does keep me off my phone and informed during meetings and court without drawing any attention, but it's pointless without reliable fitness tracking.  I'm not sold yet on the my fitness health app from Samsung either.

UPDATE: After a few program updates nothing has changed.  If anything it's worse. Sometimes when I look at the heart rate readings I see they are from 2 days ago.  I cannot stress enough, do not buy this for fitness, buy it for smart watch features only.  I wish I could have returned this watch but by the time I figured out how bad it was as a fitness watch the return window closed.  I love love Samsung products (phones, tv's, tablets, etc) but hate to say it, this is the biggest Samsung disappointment ever (and I used to have the exploding Note 7).  I may try Garmin or give up and get an iPhone just for iWatch.

I'm not necessarily a super user of this product. I feel like I've bought a Ferrari to drive around in residential zones. I mainly bought it for the interchangeable interfaces because I'm a sucker for the fallout pip boy interface.  The heartbeat sensor seems to be more accurate than my previous Fitbit watch and the stress widget is a cool feature.
Pros: amazing customizability. the bezel dial to change which widget you're on is awesome, and if you use it just as a watch the battery is a champion.
Cons: To use the full utility of it (location, messaging, heartbeat sensor, etc) I have to charge the watch once a day. You may get two days out of it at best. also, verizon message+ doesn't seem to send notifications, so I had to switch to the android default messanger app in order to get message notifications. that's more on verizon though, rather than the galaxy watch I think.
Overall, I genuinely enjoy my purchase. I switch out which watch face I use a couple times a week, just because I can. It's inspired me to be more healthy. Yup. good times :-)

I am two years into owning this watch. I use it purely as a watch and a remote control for audio books via audible and YouTube. Changing the face when you get bored of one is like getting a new watch each time. In two years I'm on my 3rd strap, a leather strap with a much nicer feel than the silicone.  The battery is still going strong, I wear it all day at work and throw it on the charger when I get home and it's never below 80%.

I've been sceptical a long time on whether smart watches were really worth it; I already have a $800 phone, so why do I need this?

Part of why I bought this was to help motivate me to lose weight after my mom said I had gained a few lbs. It tracks steps accurately, gives you reminders to move if you've been idle for an hour, will automatically detect if you've been walking or running as a workout, and a lot more. I chose this over a Fitbit because I feel the quality of the products has gone down and I really like having all the data at a glance.

Of course, everything else about it is great. I love being able to control my music through the watch, glancing at who is calling or texting me while I'm out on the greenway, and customizing the watch face (I recommend the Facer app).

The only con I can think of is why is the 42mm not available in silver? I bought a silver shield to cover mine so it looks exactly like the 46mm silver, but still... Come on Samsung, not every girl likes rose gold!

I've owned the Huawei watch 1 for several years so up until this point had nothing to compare it to. I thought that watch was great with good battery and quick response. Now that I've tried the Galaxy watch I realize how much better things have gotten. When always on is turned off I finish the day around 80% battery. That up at 5:30am and to bed by 111:00. I have the 42 mm version that has a smaller battery. With the Huawei watch I'd get maybe a day. I really did not want to turn off the always on because on the Huawei I had to shake my hand to get it to turn the display back on. Not so with the Galaxy. The screen activates every time. I was also concerned about lack of Google Wear OS. That hasn't been an issue at all. Granted I use this watch to monitor steps, sleep, tell time, and look cool. The waterproof feature was a big seller to me as well. And the readability outdoors blows the Huawei out of the water. I am seriously enjoying this watch. Couple that will the cool dial interface and you got a winner in my book.
It was delivered on time and works perfect. It's worth every dollar. I definitely will get another one.

I love this watch it's fast and effective a few things I don't like are:
1) I cannot respond to a text message I have to actively go into my contacts, find the contact and then select them and choose to send a new message.
2) The battery is at 40 something percent by the end of my clinical day, I do have a fancy watch face I downloaded (it's animated) but I don't have "always on" on.

Those are my main complaints, however, I do not mind charging my watch every night, I do not use it to track sleep. I love that I can anser calls and the mic is loud enough for me.  it's odd but if it's not connected to my phone (ie I'm too far away from my phone) I can't answer calls but I can respond to the call with a text message...
It has made it so I can have my phone close to me but not seen, it is a seriously awesome piece of tech and I'm sure everyone has their pros and cons but I'm very happy with this watch!

This thing! So I will get the bad out of the way, it relies to much on the phone to give you information it is more an alert system for apps rather than fully functional on the watch. With that said, I love the damn thing! I am a DevOps Engineer and so I depend on things I let into my space to be functional and useful with as little complication as possible. I can have up to 5 meetings per day and this smartwatch has assisted me on getting to each of these on time, improving my time management and priority management. It has also motivated on my endeavors to get away from the screen and get up and move. I average about 2 miles a day at work walking around and thought that was good enough, now I am up between 7 and 9 miles per day walking away from my work is as important as the work itself. Overall I am very happy with it especially the spotify app screen. I should have gone with the larger one but oh well. I also just preordered the Note10+ which will make this function much better over the Note 8 I am currently using.

I tried 2 less expensive types of smartwatches and found them to be ok and also a bit quirky.  I then decided to go with the Galaxy watch.  I am impressed with the many capabilities this watch has.  I can receive text messages and calls without going for my smart phone.  You can answer and talk through the watch (kind of like Dick Tracy) some of you will know what I mean.  I am pleased with the performance and reliablility of this watch.  I first loaded up too many apps and widgets that I thought were useful, but soon found that I had not used them and it did reduce the battery life with all that running in the background.  I can get about 2 days without recharging.  The BP monitor, step counter, sleep monitor, reminders and calendar are really useful for me.
