The watch is fine - it looks classy, however the watch's band is horrendous - I had it replaced within one day of buying the watch.

I purchased this watch for my son for Christmas.  He is a 1995 Rutgers graduate and loves anything having to do with the school.  He was quite surprised with this watch and wears it every day.  The price was very reasonable and was delivered exactly as promised.

I got this for my just-turning-thirteen grandson who's a Spartan fan ans though he doesn't have it yet, I know he's going to love it. Very good looking and good weight is all I can tell without opening the case but I have a good feeling about it.
Great BSU watch for the money.  Infact bought another one for my son-in-law for Christmas! Great deal! Would highly recommend!
Band is a little small,but is a nice time piece. Good price for a collage logo item.

Bought for my hubby as a just because gift and he LOVES it! So happy with this purchase! But be aware that the band is Velcro, I didn't realize until it arrived be he still loves it none the less. Great for him to work in or wear out on date night!

Watch came in quick, and we ordered in December, so that was great.  The watch is actually nicer in real life than pictured.  The band is fabric, which is what we wanted since it is for someone with sensitive skin.  Very happy with the product!
Great watch; however, as previous comments have indicated . . . band is tooooo small for medium to large wrists.

This watch is beautiful and just what I was looking for.  It looks classy and well-designed.  The one thing i am not sure of, though, is why it is called a Veteran Custom watch - but I was looking for a gift for a Penn State grad and this is perfect!

This was a birthday gift for an 11 yr old.  I was worried the watch would be too large, however, the adjustable velcro strap fit Perfectly.  The quality of the watch was impressive and the birthday boy loved his gift.  No complaints whatsoever about this purchase, it was a winner!
I bought this as a gift for my brother. He must like it. He is always wearing it.
I bought this for my fiancé and he absolutely loved the watch, but he has larger wrists so we had to buy another band.

The watch looks good, but the nylon band with the velcro strap is not as high quality as expected, and has some sharp edges, which are somewhat uncomfortable to wear. And for that reason I am no longer wearing the watch.
This was a gift for a USC fan.  The watch face is nice, looks like the picture, has velcro closure, it is a nice sports watch and looks good on a mans wrist.
Watch is great , but the battery was dead when I got it.  1st trip to have a new battery installed..  Runs fine now and looks nice on .

I ordered this for my son who attends Syracuse, but the description mentioned the playing of the school song, but the instructions do not indicate this happens, nor does it do that. The pin holding the watch band onto the watch pops out with just a slight touch, and it is extremely difficult to put the pin back in place.

I bought this watch for my husband and he really liked it.  The only thing not perfect was the size of the watch face...its enormous, but it doesn't look like it would be in the picture.  Other than that, the quality is excellent and it looks great!

The first watch broke within a few days.  You were unable to set the time ... none of the hands would move when using the knob on the side.  Amazon made it right, and rushed out a second watch.  The replacement watch has been in use for less than a week ... Hopefully the new watch will continue working.  I really like using Amazon.

This is the second one I ordered for my hubby.  The first one came broken.  But return and getting a new one was really easy.  He loves his new watch!  Only thing he wishes, is that the numbers glowed in the dark.

The watch itself is great. The band was kid sized. Even I couldn't get it on my skinny wrist. I ended up going out to have a leather band put on it so my husband could wear it, and that cost more than the watch. He loves the watch. His other UW watch was 25 years old, and we were happy we could find a "veteran" one. It's a beautiful watch, but unless your wrist is 7 inches or less, be prepared to replace the band. I'd buy again.

Good Value
It's a watch and so far it keeps time.  For the price point, it seems well constructed.  The band is adequate for a person with reasonable sized wrists.  It's good for a knock around, everyday watch where I don't want to be overly concerned about messing it up.  The large A for University of Arizona is exactly what I was looking for when I hang with ASU friends and want to rub in the University of Arizona's #1 basketball ranking!
When the watch arrived I liked the looks of it but it didn't work.  I returned it and was issued a refund.  Not sure if I will repurchase, wanted it as a gift for my dad.

This was purchased as a gift for Father's Day for my husband, who was a Texas Tech Grad. The watch was perfect gift. The velcro is nice and the face is so pretty. The Texas Tech logo pops and the stitching is very tight. For the price it exceeds quality.

After waiting a month (ordered 12/17/13), this finally came today. The face of the watch is nothing like what is shown. What came was a red faced watch with a small U on the face with the feather heading off to the side. They did correspond with me at the end of December (when it should have been already sent/received) letting me know that the watch I ordered was out of stock and gave me the option to upgrade or wait. I told them I would wait because I wanted the smaller faced watch than what was offered with the in-stock upgrade. The watch received today is a larger faced watch (bigger than 28mm). I love the simplicity of the watch shown. It looks nothing like this picture. But because my son already has waited far too long for this purchase, we will keep. However, we will more than likely never do business with these people again. =(

The watch is both stylish and affordable and it will make  the perfect Christmas gift for the true Arizona fan. Delivery was fast and affordable and it arrived  earlier then expected.Great job and I look forward to buying again in the future.

It is a very nice watch. The only problem I had was when my husband opened it, he wanted to wear it... But the band was so so very small that it didn't fit. So we are going to have to change it. But other than than, it is great.

I purchased this item because I wanted a sports like all-purpose watch to wear on game days to the Liberty Bowl Stadium and FedEx Forum for University of Memphis games.  I had a dressy type of UM logo watch but it was not appropriate for every occasion.

My biggest fear prior to ordering this watch was that the face and strap will be too small for a man.  I ordered another brand in the past and ended up giving it to my girlfriend because it was made more for either a woman's or child's wrist.

This one arrive in great shape and well packaged in a plastic case.  The face of the watch is still not as large as I prefer, but it is acceptable (I enjoy wearing large face sports watches).  The strap is a bit short for a male's wrist, but I ended up pulling the Velcro strap through the first opening of the fastener and it works just fine.  So far so good on quality and durability, and I've worn it to a couple of football games.

The biggest take-away is to give this watch second thoughts if you have a large wrist (unless you do not mind purchasing a new strap for it).  Otherwise it is a good buy at $27.  I will provide an update towards the end of the football season.

Go Tigers!!

My dad loves this watch!! it's very smart looking ... looks exactly like the photo ... works great.  Comfortable fit & my dad's a big guy.  EXTREMELY PLEASED with this purchase.  It looks like it should be a lot more expensive than it is ... thank you for the good value!

Purchased for my father-in-law who is an old MSU alumni. He's an old school kind of guy who doesn't do a lot of tech stuff. He wants it simple but does like his MSU stuff from time to time. This was a good item, reasonable price, and for those looking for the Spartan symbol in something classic and understated you can't go wrong with this watch.

reviews.review_body: This one is hard to photograph as the domed sapphire and the bezel plays tricks with the light by design along with all the reflective polished edges and surfaces too many to count. reviews.review_body: I gave this watch to my boyfriend when we went for our overseas trip. After 2 days the minute hand fell off after he took the watch off. The watch was not dropped or abused in any way. The quality of this watch is appalling. The manufacturers and Sturhrling should be ashamed of themselves. The packaging and the watch itself may be nice but if it breaks 2 days after you buy it, then buyers better hope that they buy it from a source that they can easily return the item to.
I bought this as a gift at a deep discount. Good watch, great gift.

I purchased this for my son on an Amazon Lightning Deal for just under $100. Contrary to the other review I saw, I found this watch to be well worth the money. The leather band is a shiny, patent leather and it's nicely padded on the inside. Everything was attached properly and is working fine. The face is sturdy and seems to be of good quality. There are hundreds of Stuhrling designs out there and reviews are overwhelming positive, especially on the skeleton watches. This is my son's second Stuhrling and his first (two years old now) is still in great condition. Note that he is a 17 year old and generally hard on his things. I'll update my review if after he receives the gift, we find any problems.

This watch was nowhere near the quality of the photos nor the suggested retail price. No way this is a $700+ watch. It is overpackaged to look fancy, but it's just a lot of cheap packaging surrounding a junk watch. The description boasts of fine Swiss design, Swiss quality, and produced with strict oversight by Swiss engineers, but the one tiny sticker I found which was the ONLY place anywhere that said where it was actually made..."Made in China". The leather band was horribly fake plastic looking, the metal feels cheap, and....this is the capper....the minute hand wasn't even attached! It was rattling around loose inside the face of the watch.

This product is cheap JUNK!!

12/31/2014: I have owned the watch for just over 3 weeks now.  Does not require a battery to run just need to ensure you wind it twice a day or so, I find i do it quite often now out of habit. A few complaints I have so far is the minute hand seems to fall behind every few days where I find myself resetting the time after it starts to fall behind a few minutes, I'm not sure if it's not counting seconds properly or what, I don't claim to be a watch expert.  While the band had a leather smell to it and still seems to be holding up so far, however the 2 straps that you tuck the excess band into do not seem to be made out of leather as I can already see a bit of wear on them and they definitely are not as shiny as the rest of the leather band. I don't wear it in the shower even though it's supposed to be water resistant just out of caution and the inner side of the band is more porous and has a slight odor with sweat after the 3 weeks of wear.  Unlike most other watches I have worm in my life this does not snag on my wrist hair like most metal watches do. The face and metal still show no visible scratches on the glass which makes me hope it's good quality.  Most watches I've ever owned usually have scratched faces after only owning for a week or so. I'll update in a few weeks.

reviews.review_body:
I did not purchase this item from Amazon, but I just wanted to tell everyone about the beauty and quality of this watch. This timepiece comes in 3 colors. Blue, red and green. I was fortunate enough to see all 3 models in a Houston store. I also own the red. The green model is super kewl, but it is GREEN, GREEN, GREEN.

I recommend this watch to everyone who wants a watch that is unique and different. However, I can only rate this watch at 4 stars because of the strap. It looks beautiful, but is stiff as plywood. I wore for a month, but still had to fight taking it on/off. Not kewl for this price.

I ended up buying an alligator strap with deployment clasp off Ebay for $15 as a replacement. Now I wear both watches all the time.

One last comment. The Apocalypse series is the Epiphany Collection not Special Reserve. Check out the other Apocalypse models at sturhling.com. They are all awesome!

reviews.review_body: Will you please tell me what is the real  Case diameter 0f the Rado Men's R27677152 True Black High Tech Ceramic Bracelet Watch?  I dont  think it is 24 mm as is mark.
Precision made. Bought it for it's looks.and name. The deciding factor was the red duals. Elegnant, dressy, thin and being a collector one of my dad favorites. The ceramic band Like very much.

This is a pretty solid watch.  It's a less expensive Rado than most, so you can expect to get a little less (mostly in the 'wow' factor, however).  I sized it myself.  Not using the recommended tools is a bit of a risk, but I was able to take a slat off of each side with not much frustration and thankfully no scratches.  The Ceramic Slats are way cool.  They aren't as smooth and glossy as the pictures show (thank God).  More like a black stainless steel.  They look kick-ass.  The bezel is fairly flat, but not nearly as flat as my old Movado Museum.  On some of the higher-ended Rados, they have the ultra flat, low profile bezel/crystal (that's the 'wow' factor I was talking about above that is missing somewhat with this watch).  The black on black with red highlights are what appealed most to me about this watch.  I grew up in the 80s when Swatches were the thing.  This to me, has that same kind of look but with more modern high tech components (Ceramic, Quartz and Sapphire Crystal).  I am interested to see how well it keeps time over a period of a few months.  That will be a big factor.  But for now, I'm happy after nearly a week.

reviews.review_body: Exceptionally classy and understated quality watch. Extremely accurate - only off by 1-2 seconds per week.  Striking in presence. I would recommend it to anyone.
The watch had clear handling marks on some areas. Mostly very minor marks. But it was a good purchase other wise.

As an avid collector of dive watches, I can say that entire Tudor line is superb, especially with their new in house movement that can maintain a crazy 70 hr power reserve. This watch is a perfect size, it’s relation to Rolex is obvious. I am not a gold fan on wristwatches but the very subtle outlines of the dots and hands add some great sizzle to this piece. I own three black bays - one with the older ETA movement, and two with the new movement. If there is one thing I am not crazy about it’s the riveted bracelet but apparently I am in the minority on this. The older versions have the bracelet with no rivets which I think is cleaner. Howeve of the three I won this one gets the most wear.

This is the best value for the price for any luxury timepiece out there. By a mile.

reviews.review_body: I mean, it's alright. I was thinking my wife would like it but I had to sell her to buy it, which you might think makes it pointless. But I had reached that point where you're just committed; you've made the decision in your mind and you're like, 'alright, I'm doing this' and you can't back down because if you go back on what you've decided in your mind, what kind of man are you? I mean, if you can't even stick to your own ideals, what can you stick to? So I had reached that point and realized that I didn't have the money. Well now it became a problem solving venture. I had to figure this out. I could sell the house, but then how could I keep my investment safe? I could sell my truck, but I gotta get to work to pay for the insurance on it. I could have sold my kids, but you know, future of the nation and all. So I finally settled on selling my wife. They are renewable resources as far as being able to find another and continue to do god's work. Luckily, I was able, through thrifty money wrangling, to make a decent profit, even after purchasing the watch. Now, the watch itself is a fine piece. The hands on the face a clear and easy to see. It keeps time well, although you do have to set in manually. The back is pretty neat; being able to see the workings and all. The band could use some improvement. The material is rather warm and the color isn't my cup of tea. If only my wife could have seen it. Oh well. I'm thinking of purchasing a second one to keep in a lock box. Oh, if anyone is interested, I have for sale a sturdy, hardworking personal assistant. He is about 13 and is capable of traveling at 8 mph and has a range of 80 miles on a single fill up. He is capable of lifting almost 130 lbs, but that can pushed to 160 lbs with the use of included cattle prod. If interested, feel free to contact my sales agent.

reviews.review_body:

I wear it diving, working in the yard, at the office, to dinner, where ever. It is a great value for a swiss timepiece.

reviews.review_body: absolutely beautiful watch

I Recently purchased this watch from a local jeweler, so it was a bit more expensive than here, but I have peace of mind as well. The watch is beautiful, when you can see it. The numbers disappear when not in bright light. It is not comfortable to wear and is the heaviest watch I own. For reference my Tag Heuer  F-1 auto chrono is the most comfortable bracelet watch I own. The Breitling bezel seems thick and the dial seems small, given it's a 45mm width. The reason I have this is because I went for the Super Avenger chrono, but at 48mm it was WAAAAAY too big for my smaller wrist. There is no denying the quality you will get with an authentic Breitling. I do love this watch and have worn it a few times already. I have quite a few watches so it's more of a round-robin situation for me. The volcano black dial is very black, but not shiny. There is just enough red to add interest, but avoid fashion fatigue. The stencil like numerals give it a tougher look. The watch sits high above the wrist and is very thick.

reviews.review_body: Styling is awesome.  A lot of watch for the
I get comments all the time about this watch. Beautiful watch that looks expensive but is very cheap. You can't beat this product for the price

I bought this watch a few months ago and from the time I received it I've loved it.  It's a gorgeous watch and the size is perfect (for my larger wrist).  Now, on to the negative.  I researched this watch for hours on the internet before buying and seen very few negatives about the watch.  One of my main concerns was the quality of the crystal.  This watch (supposedly) has a Krysterna crystal which is one of the strongest crystals a watch can have.  They're supposed to be basically indestructible.  I've worn this watch almost everyday since owning and wear it to work and in casual settings.  This watch did NOT get abused in any way.  I noticed one day though that there was a scratch on the crystal.  I was furious, as I'm sure most would be.  So, I took it off and the next day I looked at the watch again and it had cracked the ENTIRE way through from side to side.  My watch now needs a replacement crystal, which I'm sure isn't cheap.  The crystal is NOT covered through the warranty.  Stuhrling claims to sell "quality" pieces but I beg to differ.  So, stay away from this watch, or at least buying through amazon (I now question if the watch was authentic).
Dull face despite the colorful bright face in ad. Just about the right size. Overall a nice watch for the price.

reviews.review_body:
These watches are your average Wal-Mart/Target low-end watch, dressed up by marketing to be something more than they are. They have:

- Ruthlessly basic quartz movement
- Very little heft
- Very little in the way of build quality
- Very little in the way of features

When you actually hold them in your hand and examine them, they compare equally to unbranded/generic Wal-Mart/Target watches in the $20-$30 retail range. I certainly wouldn't pay more than that for this watch.

And frankly, you'll get a far better watch spending $30-$40 on a Timex, which while basic and meant to be, is built to a generally higher quality level. Do not pay MSRP on these for any reason ($300 range is laughable) and do not even pay the Amazon price without handling one first, as you're likely to imagine that you're getting more for it than you actually are.

Loved it

My 9 year old Tag Heuer Teal Professional Quartz watch is still a beautiful timepiece and I will continue to wear it in rotation, but I wanted to move up a notch. I shopped for weeks looking for something in my price range with all the correct features.

This watch caught my eye because of the color and I appreciated the concept of the hybrid electromechanical drive. As an engineer, time accuracy is important. I didn't want a strictly automatic engine because of the annoying minor time drift most suffer from. Adjusting the watch becomes more of a hobby than it needs to be and I am sure I would obsess about it.

This watch is substantial. It has the nice, heavy feel I enjoy having on my wrist. The band is wonderful. I looked at a few Breitling watches, but the bands turned me off because of the way they tear arm hair out. The Tag Heuer band does not. It's bright and shiny and reflects light in a most enjoyable way.

I will likely use the chronograph features of this watch only a few times a year. Unlike a lot of chronographs, the timer functions on this watch are unobtrusive. (It uses the clock hands for timing at the press of a button!)

It's a little tricky to set this watch up. It has "modes" of operation unlocked based on the position of the sweep hand and the crown stop. The calendar is perpetual. That's a welcome feature. You set it and forget it. No more being bothered by having to manually adjust the date at the end of months of less than 31 days. It's Leap Year aware as well.

If you are looking for a quality luxury watch at an affordable price point, you can't go wrong with a Tag Heuer like this one.

The watch in itself is very nice. Amazon screwed up my order and delivered a citizen instead. It has been over 6 weeks and ~30 phone calls and i still have not recd my money back from Amazon. Had to actually order the watch from Amazon. Amazon is great if they can get your order right. God forbid if they mess it up, they have no system or process in place to take care of you.

Go to a specialized watch eretailer. That would be my advice.

A short review of this watch:

Weight:  It was not as heavy as I expected (even though it is quartz and I knew it would be lighter than an automatic), but it has a substantial quality to it. If you are new to the luxury watch market and are worried about getting used to the weight, this might be a good selection. For those that love a big heavy watch, this is probably too light for your taste, but like I said, still substantial.  I like a heavy watch, and while this is far from the heaviest that I own, I'm still pleased with it from this aspect.

Size: With dimensions of 43mm and 13 mm, I again was surprised by the relative size. As with the weight, the size is substantial, but it's nowhere near the size of another 43mm and 13mm watch that I have. (yes, it measures the correct dimensions, but this watch is crafted in a way where it tapers from the middle to the top and bottom in a very stylish manner making it appear smaller than the dimensions would otherwise lead you to believe.) Again still substantial, and a good comprise between the understated nature of a Patek and the monsterous quality of a Breitling (and yes, much cheaper than either of those as well, but just an example for purposes of comparison).

Overall on size, I think it's a good balance. I would not imagine any adult male complaining about the watch's size (too big or too small) after a week or so of wearing it.

Bracelet/Band:  Looks like the picture. This particular band has 2 additional flat surfaces on each shiny link (the shiny center link is squared at the top and the bottom) compared to other watches that i own/have seen. It catches the light more than your standard band of this style which I like.  At a glance it looks a little different than the more common type of this watch band where the center shiny links have rounded edges. Admittedly, this is a very subtle difference.

Perpetual calendar: Had to read the manual to figure out how to change the time, date, year, but once you figure it out, it's very logical. There is even a "cheat sheet" engraved on the back of the watch to remind you when the season's change and you don't feel like digging up the manual. The perpetual calendar is a nice feature so you only have to set the date once (and then whenever the battery runs out.) The bottom half moon dials tell you the date in regular time mode.

Chronograph: This watch uses the main hands as its chronograph which makes it very easy to read.  A little different than most other chronographs so a nice change if you collect watches, or if you hate all of the dials on the face of the watch but still want a chronograph.

Ragatta function: This is basically a countdown mode. It uses the hour and minute hand moving together counting down on the hours markers from 10 to 0. The thought here is that you get 10 minutes to set your boats up in a boat race and this watch counts those 10 minutes down for you. There is also apparently an additional 5 minutes that you get in the race that the watch can also countdown.  In all likelihood a completely worthless feature from a functionality perspective for nearly everyone who buys this watch, but its something your boss's watch probably won't do, for what that's worth.

Overall:  The only complaint that I have is the type of links this watch uses. They are nearly impossible to remove yourself without risking bending a pin. Take it to a watch store to get that taken care of. The watch itself is very nice, and for amazon's price, I think you're getting an extremely good deal. Own a lot of watches, and spent a great deal of time researching this purchase, and I'm very pleased.

This watch is different. There is no manual adjustments. Everything is electronic and runs off the battery. Even the crown doesn't move the hour and minute hands. It has dual motors in it that perform all the movements. Everything is set by pressing the buttons and the battery in this is larger, and harder to find than most as a result. I had to go to batteries+ to get it.

This watch is on the lighter side but still heavy enough to indicate that it is solid. The dial does not move. It is for this weird regatta countdown that only is useful for people who sail and participate in sailboat racing.

I do like the feel of this watch. The latch is nice and tight. The bracelet is very sharp looking and shines quite well after every polish. This watch will not scream luxury - it is more casual.

What I don't like about this watch is that it gets out of sync and gets misaligned often. This is a problem for many people. I bought this over ten years ago and sent it in twice to get realigned. Turns out there is a factory reset function that allows you to realign all the hands to the zero position. Again, all done electronically. As simple as that might be, it does take about ten to fifteen minutes to do it and set the time again.

I would not buy this watch again, and I don't think they even sell it anymore. It is a unique concept but a watch that costs this much should not need to be re calibrated a few times a year. It appears that Tag Heuer tried too hard to make all of this electronic and the complication of how to set it, multiple countdown functions, perpetual calendar, etc. and it didn't work out perfectly.

This watch is incredibly poorly made. It completely lacks quality. It is very nice to look at but it broke (second hand fell of and got stuck) LITERALLY 1 month after I bought it. I am a doctor and only wear it to the office twice a week. Which means it broke after less than 10 days of use.

I requested a refund from the company, they said no. I sent it in for a repair after I HAD TO PAY for shipping. It came back working, but then the second hand fell off again after 2 months, again with minimal use. I sent it again (Yes, after I had to pay AGAIN for shipping). It worked for about 2 more months until the second hand fell of again.

I am not making any of this up. Please see the attached picture of what to expect: the second hand fell off and got stuck rendering the watch useless.

DO NOT BUY this watch.

I got this as a gift for my boyfriend and he really loves it. He can wear it with his casual shirts/button downs and it doesn't look too flashy, but when he does get dressed it fits very well. He always gets compliments and people ask about his watch when they notice the mechanical face and he loves taking it off and showing them the back. He is an engineer and loves how this watch works.

It keeps pretty accurate time when it is moving. If you take it off and don't wear it for awhile you will have to reset the time. But once it's moving its accurate within a minute. He did have to take it to a jeweler to remove the extra link. They have instructions on how to pop it out but it is much more difficult than it looks. It's easier to have someone who knows what they're doing take it out.

A great buy for the price. This was a starter watch for him and would be a great present for any teenager or young man.

The small second dial on the front is  a nice touch. It would have been too plain without that. The crown is marked with the RW logo, as is the back. Not good

This is my third Raymond Weil watch and I'm a fan of the brand so my review might be a little biased.

I really love this watch and I get lots of compliments when I wear it. I'd go as far as to say this is my favorite watch in my collection. As another reviewer said, pictures do not do it justice. It's very refined looking and elegant in an understated way. It's is a large watch but not it's uncomfortably large or heavy. However, it is large enough to make buttoning the sleeves of some brands of dress shirts almost impossible (no problems with French cuffs though). Not really an issue for me,  I just pick a shirt that works with the watch.

The only thing I really didn't like about this watch was the band. I don't have a really large wrist but the stock band on this watch looked tiny and cheap. Not what I'd expect on a watch that supposedly retailed for $1,250.00. Perhaps I got a watch set up for a market other than the US, I'm not sure. However, I swapped it out for a Hadley Roma contrast stitch band and it completely transformed the watch. Made it super stunning! Issue solved but that's a one star deduct since I had to buy a band for a brand new watch.

The only real problem I've had in a year of ownership is with the durability of the inner works. The watch slipped off my bed and fell onto a rug that was on a hardwood floor. That two foot fall knocked the hands out of alignment and jarred something inside that made the watch completely stop. I took it to my jeweler and he got it working again but now it's randomly stopping so it's back at the jeweler again. Hopefully he can find the problem and get it resolved this time. Since I caused the  issue I'm not deducting any stars but buyers need to be aware that these watches are quite fragile.

Overall, I love the watch and if this one can't be repaired I'll consider buying another. I'll just be a lot more careful with the replacement.

reviews.review_body: Husband doesn’t like wearing watches, but sometimes he needs a chronometer that isn’t a cell phone.  He owns no jewelry.  But he likes this watch and I see him wear it often.  Watch has subtle geek cred and masculine styling.

This was a gift for my husband for Father's Day. He's very picky about watches and after losing his Rolex didn't really want to replace it with anything that didn't match up to his eclectic style. He actually guided my decision with the style of watch he was looking for. I ended up choosing this one for the watch band. It arrives in a long wooden box which makes it look suspended in the air, which was a really nice touch. The watch itself is beautiful. The internal workings are interesting and enchanting, and the colors really play well off each other. It's fun that you can wind the watch, but you don't even need to do that because it works off the movement of your hand. My husband has yet to let it unwind completely. It's waterproof, he's worn it in the pool without damaging it.

The only minor complaint is that when the watch isn't snug against his wrist, the ticking can get pretty loud. Nothing deafening, of course (it's only a watch), but you can hear it when you're next to him on the couch.

This is such an awesome watch that I'm hoping Rougois makes a more slender version with a bracelet strap for me!

This watch is a show stopper. I constantly have people asking about it. I had an older version of this wathc which i unfortunately lost so i bought a new one. The older version of the watch was quite finicky and i had to send it to a watch repair shop in Boston twice. It is chinese made with a fancy sounding european name "Roujois". It is nontheless a chinese made watch. After i had the watch store in boston fully tear it apart ,clean all components and put back together i never had another problem with it....until i lost it. I loved the watch so much i bought another one. reviews.review_body:
Up until this one watch, every one of the six purchased from Stührling, varying in price from $70 to $200, has been perfect in function and satisfying in design. Perhaps a note of caveat would be that the Kristerna glass is not as hard and shock and scratch resistant as one would expect given the manufacturers description of it. That aside, Stührling makes very reliable, elegantly designed and sturdy watches at a comfortable price range.

This unit, however, beautiful as it is, broke the pattern. I just retuned it four days ago because the chrono second hand would not zero at noon. On a subjective note, it was hard to read at a glance in lighting conditions less than bright. It is for this reason I haven't yet decided to order a replacement.

reviews.review_body: goooooodddd!!!
Outstanding design, build quality and value. Smart and understated and highly recommended, especially at the offer price

So far, it's fantastic. It's great to see this level of quality at this price, and with a manufacture movement no less. The dial is fantastic, I couldn't tell beforehand if it was white or silver, and in person it is much the same. With daylight directly on the dial it's obviously silver, but in other light it typically looks white, giving the dial a bit of intrigue. The movement is fully decorated, with every visible surface dressed in some type of finishing. The circular cotes de Geneve on the backplate are mesmerizing.

I opted for the bracelet, which is the most comfortable bracelet I own due to the small links.

The finish of every surface is flawless, and dial can be viewed nearly sideways through the domed sapphire crystal without interference.

100% happy with my purchase. Bought this for myself to commemorate my Bachelor's degree, and I feel the level of quality is absolutely up to pat for such an occasion.

- Update 7/2016 -
Have had the watch for a fee months now, it is keeping excellent time. I do keep it on a winder when not in use. Also bought a 21mm leather strap that compliments the watch nicely.

To be more specific the "ZIZ" logo in the photo is on the top right. reviews.review_body: Ordered this watch from WatchMaxx. Everything arrived in perfect condition with all pieces (product cards, manual and limited edition case). The watch is amazing...looks great, I am so glad I waited and saved for the limited edition. For sure worth it. Highly recommend this watch.

This limited edition "James Bond" Seamaster Professional appears to be a "gray market" watch which was obtained from another dealer.  The warranties on gray market watches come from the seller, not the manufacturer.  What you have to ask yourself is this:  Do I want to purchase a special, "limited edition" (10,007 watches were produced) that doesn't have a valid Omega warranty card with it?  This is not to say that there is anything at all wrong with the watch.  But Omega won't fix any problems with it.  And you are totally dependent upon the seller for service.  As for myself, if I were going to purchase a limited edition watch, I would want ALL of the paperwork to come with it, to include the original warranty cards.  I understand that purchasing a "gray market" watch can save you some money, but the savings may not always be worth it.  I've never purchased anything from this seller, and have nothing negative to state except that I don't think that a "collectible watch" that was purchased on the gray market is going to hold the same value as one with the original warranty card.  It's also a lot of money for a watch that no authorized Omega service center would work on.
I get that Japanese Movements are as well if not better at times (no pun) then Swiss but I don't think real Omega watches use them. Js because that's what it says

Omega Planet Ocean Black Dial Stainless Steel Mens Watch 232 30 46 21 01 002
Omega Planet Ocean Black Dial Stainless Steel Mens Watch 232 30 46 21 01 002

reviews.review_body: I've had this watch for 3 months now and initially I was going to buy a Breitling watch but I fell in love with this watch when I saw it. I love the physical appearance of the watch, the bright orange bezel, the beautifully made dial and luminous Super-LumiNova applied to the indexes on the dials and hands which shows up nicely in the dark. My favourite part of the watch is it has a transparent sapphire crystal case back to see the co-axial 8500 movements which personally is a nice feature. It has automatic winding in both directions and has a Power reserve of about 60 hours which is great as I wear this watch most days! It looks nice on my wrist, feels great and is quite weighty. I have received a lot of compliments at work from customers and collegues since purchasing it.

This was my dream watch and my dream finally came true. I have been wearing it every day and it's been very accurate, I did have omega regulate it to run +1 sec a day and it's been very precise. The quality is superb and feels very sturdy, pretty heavy but not too bad. There was a few things I didn't like at first but now I'm fine with them. The bracelet couldn't fit my wrist perfectly since there isn't a micro adjustable clasp. It was either too tight or too lose. I had to buy an extra half link from omega in order to get the right fitment. Now all is well. Second thing is, the anti reflective crystal can easily smudge but it looks amazing when it's clean. I also hear it the AR coating can scratch but mine has been okay so far. I have a tint scratch in the middle that is only visible with certai. Light/angles so it's not bothering me at all. Overall, great watch. Lived up to my expectations.

The watch looks even better than the photos. After a few weeks, the automatic movement has settled in nicely to just 1-3 seconds of time gain a day. This is well within COSC specs without the COSC price.
Slightly faster is easy to deal with(easy to adjust since it is faster, not slower).

Buying direct from Amazon is recommended.

When I first opened the box I rally liked the way the watch looked. Once I removed the watch from the box I was alarmed at how light weight and cheap the band felt. Product did not keep proper time. I owned this watch for a few weeks and had to reset the time every other day. I had to pay for the shipping to return it.

I’m very happy with this watch- it really is a beautiful time piece. This is not the first stuhrling watch I have purchased, and so far I haven’t had problems with the quality. This watch arrived in a think orange sturhling box. It’s padded to protect the watch during shipment and it makes for a nice presentation if you’re giving the watch as a present. The watch face is also covered with plastic to protect it from scratching.
I gave this to my boyfriend as a birthday present. He loves it and get’s compliments on it every time he wears it. The look is so classy and I like watching all the components of the skeleton watch. Also, because the arms of the watch are blue they’re very easy to see so you can read the time. I feel like if they were silver they would get lost on the watch face- so I think the color is a great touch.

This watch is an automatic watch, which means it doesn’t have a battery and it needs to be wound. This watch is kinetic, so as you wear it throughout the day the watch automatically winds itself which is a neat feature. The downside of this is that if you let the watch sit for too long, it’ll stop and you’ll have to reset the watch.

The one thing I will say is that this watch face is on the large side and because the band is also metal it’s a pretty heavy watch. The metal band is also big, we had to remove a few links for it to fit him well and he’s a fairly large man. If you have small wrists I wouldn’t recommend this watch, but otherwise it’s fantastic.

Overall I think this is a great product and it would make a fantastic gift. I’m very happy I was able to purchase this watch at a promotional rate in exchange for my honest review.

reviews.review_body:
Its a looker of a watch, and is extremely reliable.... when its working.

Purchased in June, 2014 through a cruise line, and the one I got out of the box was defective.  It simply would not keep time correctly at all.  So when I got home, I called up Stuhrling customer service, and they were very nice and extremely helpful.  As long as you are within 90 days of purchase, Stuhrling will replace your watch, no questions asked, and will cover the full cost of shipping, so for those purchasing on Amazon, that is a very nice backup to have.

The replacement I got works very well, and keeps impressively accurate timing.  The only drawbacks I've seen are if you keep it in one position too long (especially if the face is horizontal) it will stop, so wearing it overnight sometimes will lead you to having to set the time in the morning.  However, for the most part it usually behaves extremely well, and does a good job in keeping itself wound through the course of the day.  The automatic ticking of it isn't too bad, and you rarely hear it during the day unless it catches your ear at the right angle, but it can be a little annoying at night if you don't have any white noise to drown it out.

With all that said, the one I got has a different face than the one shown here, despite being the same model.  The innards of mine are all silver, and not the Rose gold seen here.  I suspect this is an error in the photoshopping of the watches when showing the different colors available.

In the end, I absolutely love this watch, and recommend it to anyone.  I rarely go out and not get a compliment on it by those who see it.

reviews.review_body: AWESOME! Very tough watch! I use it while treaking, hiking, swimming and diving totally an amazing buy

I've owned a few high-end watches for several years and bought my Avenger Blackbird at an authorized dealer only because it was my first Breitling.  Simply stated, this is an awesome watch!  Very high quality, durable and looks great.  Classy without being over-sized or bulky.  Mine came with both a black and an olive-drab colored strap.  They too were very finely crafted.  I've since purchased another Breitling on Amazon, and it too is a super nice time piece.

Bezel and dial broke within a year.  Cloth strap frayed within months.  I only used the watch occasionally and never in a harsh environment or a rough manner.  Breitling's service center claimed "impact."  Totally untrue ... there was no impact and wasn't the slightest bit of evidence of impact - no scrathes, scuffs or marks of any kind.  It just broke.  So, the company did not stand behind its warranty and charged a fortune for the repair.  As a pilot for many years I was excited to get my first Breitling.  Now I'm afraid to wear the watch for normal everyday use and will attempt to trade it in for a more durable timepiece (and will never purchase another Breitling).  It looks great, but will not last.
My favorite watch without question. First Breitling and it won't be my last.

I bought this very nice looking watch from a duty free store -not through Amazon- 2 weeks ago. So far I can comment on 2 issues. One is the material of the bezel which is very sensitive and scratch very easily. I do care for my watches but it is surprising how easily can scratch. The other issue has to do with the accuracy. It is very fast on my wrist and slow on the auto winder. Of course it is a mechanical watch but 5-6 seconds a day is not what someone expect when buying a Breitling. My Omega Planet Ocean Big blue is more accurate. And even my Raymond Weil Freelancer is also very accurate, of approximately 0-1 sec per day. So careful when you decide to buy. Big caution to avoid scratches, although in the course of time inevitably several will occur.

Stay away from this watch and Breitling at all costs!  The dial on this watch broke for no reason, its a common problem on this watch.  Breitling will claim that it got hit and void your warranty!  They will charge to fix it!  This company does not honor their warranty and doesn't stand behind their product!  And I didn't buy my avenger blackbird on Amazon, i bought it at an authorized retailer!
Nailed it. The watch arrived in perfect condition in the original box, and with all appropriate documents. Couldn’t be happier.

reviews.review_body:
If you are like me, then you enjoy researching big ticket items as much as the purchase.  I can't say that it eliminates buyer's regret but the hangover doesn't last nearly as long.  I purchased the Omega Planet Ocean 6 months ago with some trepidation because of the price and a bad experience that I once had with a Rolex.  I was concerned about the price because it cost considerably more than the Omega Seamaster.  The Seamaster is also a diver's watch and has a proven track record.  In fact, the watch that James Bond* wore in Casino Royale was a special edition quartz Seamaster. In this review, I will attempt to answer the following questions:

Is it worth paying more money for a Planet Ocean, than for it's predecessor, the Seamaster?

How does the Planet Ocean stack up to more expensive competitor, Rolex Sea Dweller?

*Note: James Bond wore the Planet Ocean in a Quantum of Solace.

While conducting this review, I'll also try to educate the novice on the basic components of a watch: bezel, movement, band, crystal, case, and the face (dial, marker, hands).  Without understanding each of these components, you cannot accurately compare watches. Of course, there are other factors as well as intangibles to be taken into consideration (warranty, prestige, price, etc.).

1.  The crystal is the transparent cover that allows one to view the time while protecting the face of the watch from damage.  The difference in quality and price varies according to the scratch resistance (hardness) of the crystal and the anti-reflective coating that have become standard on high end diver's watches.  Any watch costing more than $150 will generally have one of three crystals: Mineral, Sapphire, and Ceramic.  All Rolex and Omega watches come with Sapphire or Ceramic.  Ceramic (yttrium-stabilized zirconia) is the newest and most technologically advanced material.  For the sake of concision, the minor advantages of a ceramic bezel aren't worth the premium price at this time.

The Planet Ocean and all of the competing diving watches in this class come with sapphire crystal. Sapphire crystal is aptly named because it's literally a lab produced corundum. For those of you who are not gemologists, sapphires and rubies are fancy names for red and blue corundum!  Corundum has a 9 on the Mohs hardness scale (diamond = 10). Ergo, nothing below 9 on the Mohs hardness scale should easily scratch it.  I'm very hard on watches but still haven't managed to scratch the P.O.'s sapphire crystal.  The harder a substance, the more brittle it is, therefore, you're be just as likely to shatter a sapphire crystal than scratch it. If the crystal is raised (i.e. Sea Dweller), the exposed edge is also susceptible to being chipped.  Fortunately, this is not a problem with the Planet Ocean since the sapphire crystal sits flush with the stainless steel bezel (replaceable).

Besides the way the sapphire crystals are mounted, the chief differences between diving watches involve the anti-reflective coating, or lack thereof. The Omega Seamaster and the Rolex Sea Dweller both put the anti-reflective coating on the inside of the crystal while the Planet Ocean has translucent blue tinted anti-reflective coating on both the outside and inside of the crystal. Note: You can only see the 'blue tint' by tilting the watch at an angle.  Before purchasing this watch, I read an amateur review from a Sea Dweller owner who stated that Omega made a mistake because the exterior anti-reflective coating leaves noticeable marks when scratched.  I've found that criticism to be highly exaggerated. In fact, I wear this watch daily and have put some scratches on the band but cannot find any marks on the coating.  If you are actually going to use this watch for it's intended purpose (scuba diving), then you will absolutely want to have this exterior coating because it works much better than the interior coating alone!  IMHO, I love the crystal's signature bluish hue because it's the simplest way to distinguish an authentic P.O. from a cheap forgery.

2. Movement is the 'motor' of the watch that keeps the time, date, etc.  Each separate mechanical function of a watch is called a 'complication'.  With premium watches, you generally have three choices when it comes to movement: Quartz, winding, and automatic.  Quartz watches are more accurate and less expensive, but require batteries.  Question:  Why would anyone with half a brain want an automatic watch then?  Answer: Multiple reasons! While automatic and winding movements are less practical and generally require more maintenance over the long haul, the difference is the artistry, ingenuity, and elegance of a mechanical movement.  This is where the Omega Planet Ocean surpasses virtually every other watch out there including the Rolex Sea Dweller. The Caliber 2500 movement is based on an ETA 2892-2 (ETA is owned by the same company, Swatch group that owns Omega).  Several innovations make this 27 jewel movement extraordinary.  Due to the 'Co-Axial Displacement' the self winding (automatic) movement has managed to substantially reduce friction, thus requires much less lubrication than any other automatic movements manufactured today! What that means to you, my friend is that your new Planet Ocean watch will not require expensive servicing for 10 YEARS! FYI, that's twice as long as any Rolex. The drastically reduced friction within the movement also doubles the lifespan of the watch! Additionally, Caliber 2500 movement has been equipped with a 'free sprung balance' that's a 'state of the art' simplified regulating system which greatly improves the COSC timing precision.  In other words, this watch keeps exceptionally accurate time for a mechanical watch.  In my experience, this watch has kept almost perfect time +/- 1 second a day and under 2 seconds a week.  FYI: All mechanical watches tend to run fast by a few seconds per week during the first 6 to 18 months because of the initial factory lubrication. As the lubrication thins and spreads, high end mechanical watches generally become more accurate. Since the P.O. doesn't need as much lubrication, the accuracy out of the box is amazing.  It's the only mechanical watch that I've owned that's lived up to it's billing when it comes to keeping time.

3.  Case:  The Omega Planet Ocean's case is beautiful, rugged, and well designed with twice the water resistance rating of the Seamaster at 600m/1200ft. While that's half of the water resistance of the Rolex Sea Dweller, it's a moot point since the diving depth record with a breathing apparatus is only 313m!  To give you a reference point, the most advanced atomic submarine (US Sea Wolf class) has a maximum diving depth of 500 meters.  Omega invented the helium release value that made watches better suited for longer deeper dives.  Without it, the pressure change upon returning to the surface would pop out the crystal. On the Planet Ocean, the release value is manual and looks like another winding clasp but is inscribed 'He' (the scientific symbol for helium). FYI- the safety value doesn't need to be deployed for normal swimming and diving.

Oh yeah, I almost forgot to mention the beautiful depiction of the Omega sea monster [hippokampoi] is on the case back.  Not only is it attractive, but it's the easiest way to determine if the watch is a genuine Planet Ocean.  While counterfeit watches don't seem to have trouble imitating the Rolex green hologram sticker, I've searched the internet and have never seen a convincing forgery of the Omega sea monster on the back case.  If you don't believe me, then go to the fake watch sites on the internet and do a comparison.  The counterfeiters know that most people who purchase counterfeit watches are only interested in fooling passive onlookers.

4. On the Planet Ocean, the bezel is the black or orange 'coin edged' unidirectional rotating stainless steel ring that surrounds the crystal.  The Omega Planet Ocean's 'easy grip' bezel has 120 clicks (stopping points) stopping precisely on the markers.  FYI:  If you are diving with this watch, then the bezel is one of the most important features. For others who simply enjoy the styling and durability of a diving watch, the bezel provides a quick way to determine the quality, precision, and attention to detail that was put into the watch.

5.  The band is the least important feature of a watch as far as I'm concerned.  The band can be changed and will probably be replaced long before the watch dies of natural causes.  Nevertheless, an expensive watch should come with a solid clasped high grade stainless steel, gold, or titanium band (I abhor leather and plastic).  The Omega Planet Ocean's band is first rate.  I found the it to be very comfortable and secure with no sharp edges. The clasping mechanism works flawlessly. Being that it is a diving watch, the clasp has a clever mechanism that painlessly extends the band to allow it to fit over a diving suit (or jacket sleeve). Fortunately, the band is brushed stainless steel so it doesn't show scratches like the polished case.

6. Face (dial, marker, hands)-  The Planet Ocean's hands and makers are coated with Superluminova resin.  That means that when you turn out the lights, you do not have trouble making out the time for 30 minutes or so.  The arrow tipped hands distinguish the Planet Ocean from the Sea Master and the Ocean Dweller. Another cool feature is that you can distinguish the hands from one another even at 12:00! The date does not require magnification.  I've always felt that magnified dates aka cyclops interferes with the elegance of a watch. While this is a matter of personal preference, many people must agree since Rolex does not include the cyclops on the Sea Dweller.

Finally, I must mention the size.  The Planet Ocean is a relatively big watch at 45.5mm and weighs 9oz.  I like bigger watches but it's a matter of taste.  I'm a large man (6'3" 210lbs) so it fits me proportionally.  For someone with a smaller frame or thinner wrists, Omega makes a slightly diminutive version (42mm) of the standard PO.  Whichever version you choose, the Plane Ocean will never be mistaken for a lady's watch!

CONCLUSION:  While the PO does cost more than the Seamaster, I believe that it's well worth the extra price because of the improved movement and styling. You are also paying $5000 less than the Sea Dweller. I love my Planet Ocean and highly recommend it.

I Boughtthis watch version XL and its the best size for me ,the quality its excelent, the antireflectling  glare looks very good, i recomend this watch and this watch have the COSC certification swiss only the 2% of the watches made in swiss has it , five stars.....

I am rather opinionated when it comes to luxury watches.  This comes from spending 2 years in watchmaking school, studying directly under the guidance of a certified master swiss watchmaker who came here from Europe.  Watches, especially mid to high grade swiss watches, are a passion of mine.  I am not loyal to a brand or a style or anything else.  I judge them for what they are, in terms of quality, function, construction, and style.  A watchmakers point of view.

This said I will tell you that this particular watch is what I consider to be a "best kept secret" sort of watch.  This is an AUTOMATIC watch (read: Mechanical - NOT Quartz), and of CHRONOMETER grade function.  Chronometer as used here is a measure of accurate timekeeping, not quality - a point often misunderstood - and is used mostly from a marketing point of view by companies such as Rolex.  HOWEVER.  This movement in THIS watch is actually EXCELLENT in terms of quality, time keeping ability, and construction - easily comparable to other Swiss made movements from other famous manufacturers costing several times as much.  This watch, properly serviced, will provide a lifetime of use - and probably more.  Absolutely the sort of watch you pass down to the next generation.

All in all - and EXCELLENT choice - especially for those seeking their first QUALITY Swiss watch purchase.

Definitely recommended!

I have a couple of luxury watches - a Girard Perregaux that I use for formal occasions and a Tag Heuer for everyday use. The steel band on my Tag broke, and I used that as an excuse to finally upgrade. I considered a Rolex, Cartier (Roadster), Breitling, Omega, or another GP. After prowling around luxury watch forums/reviews, I settled on the Omega SPS as having the best value for the money. Rolex makes great watches, but they're so ubiquitous with so many fakes floating around that it doesn't feel "special". Cartier seems to be widely panned by luxury watch afficionados - apparently its mechanism is so sensitive that it must be sent in to Cartier for routine maintenance every 3-5 years at a cost of $700 a pop!! The Breitling models I liked have monstrous sizes...they looked incongrous on my 7" wrist. In the end, I settled on the Omega SPS - and I believe I made the right decision. It's gorgeous - it looks and feels substantitive without looking pretentious. The red/orange 6, 9, and 12 numbers on the dial catches the eye. I think this is a great luxury watch for everyday use. It certainly feels like it can take a lot of abuse.

Make sure to get the one with non-red markers, James Bond wears the version with all white markers.  James Bond also wears the XL version (45.5mm case)  And obviously, he doesn't wear the one with the orange bezel (yeeech).  There are two versions of this watch coming out just like for the last James Bond watch.  But seriously, do you think James Bond would wear a watch that says "Quantum of Solace" or "007" engraved in back of his watch?  Seriously.  Do yourself a favor and get NOT get the limited edition, but the regular model.  But I guess people buy for different reasons.

Having said that, this is a great, practical watch for everyday wear if you want to look cool with a touch of class.  I would not wear this for sports or to the gym because I like to keep my watches in near mint condition.  The price is not awfully expensive as a Rolex but works possibly even better and looks just as great as a Rolex.  I'm very suprised how much the Omega Seamaster is beginning to look more and more like a Rolex Submariner.  The last Seamaster is quite distintive in that it's Bond version has a blue face with a nice geometrically carved bezel and intricate bracelet band (but not to everyone's tastes).  Now, for the Planet Ocean, we see the famous fluted bezel that is signature of Rolex.  We see the Bond version is all black a la Bond Rolex Submariner.  And gone also is the intricate-looking band which now looks very much like the Rolex Oyster bracelet with just a slightly different line of design.  There are some differences.  The PO case is quite elegant and very reminiscent of car body design.  However, the side profile of the case still lacks the elegance of Rolex.  Another obvious difference is the size.  The Rolex Submariner is 40mm which is perfect for any wrist.  Last Seamster Professional was 41mm which is still perfect.  This watch?  A whopping 45.5mm!!!  It's huge.  Make sure you are fine with the size.  With a large diametered case also comes the added weight!  I love the nice heft but this may not be suitable for everyone.  Although many of these differences are quite subjective, what is pretty much objective is the clasp of these watches.  Time and time again, people complain why the most famous all watches come with a flimsy, cheap clasp?  Omega Seamaster clasp totally blows it away as it is very solid and quite easy to operate.

So now we have an Omega that looks and feels much like a Rolex.  Omega is like the Lexus of watches.  It does a lot of things great and maybe even better but it will always be second status to Rolex a la Lexus to Mercedes.  No matter how hard Lexus tries to be a Mercedes, it will always be a Lexus.  With that said, both Lexus and Omega make solid, quality products with a more affordable price tag.  Give this, I would wear an Omega practicially everyday and just leave the special occasions for my Rolex Submariner.  However if you are really particular on wanting the very best, you may want to be a bit more patient in saving for that Rolex.  I gave so many reasons to buy this watch but the only reason to buy a Rolex is because it's a Rolex!

I love this watch. The 2201.51 (black bezel / orange numerals) was given to me as a gift and I have not taken it off since I received it. I don't track how accurate it is to the second like some people do, but suffice to say that it is very very accurate, and I believe what others have said about this movement.

There are three things I absolutely love about this watch.

First, the clarity: It is about as clear and easy to read as I have ever had. Irrespective of light, a quick glance will always tell me the time. In dark light, the superluminova makes it very easy. I suspect this has to do with antireflective coating on both sides of the sapphire and all that tech stuff but frankly, all I care for is the end value to me.

Second, the fit and finish of the case and bracelet are absolutely top notch. Its almost a work of art because of the amount of detail in the watch. Everything from the hippocampus engraving in the back to the placement of the crowns. Everything is "just" right and it feels very natural.

Third, despite the fact that this is technically a sports watch (I swim once in a while and keep it on), I wear it to work and dressy occasions. Since its not super flashy and I usually wear long cuffs, people don't usually notice  it. Frankly, I like that it goes under the radar like that. That said, twice someone did comment on it, and both times they knew exactly what it was! Must be watch affectionados.

Needless to say, I love this watch and wear it everyday. If you have the money, it is definitely worth the price of entry. I'm not a collector so for me, I don't think I'll be purchasing another watch anytime soon.

UPDATE AFTER 1 YEAR: Still loving this timepiece. It ticks away and is quite accurate. I have made the mistake of trying to reset the time (while travelling) near 12 and the watch gave me a warning sign with a "click"...so I'll be careful not to do that anymore. The 48hour charge is accurate. When I leave it sitting, it will go about 2 days before stopping. Outside of that; it ticks away quite reliably. I must say that over the course of the last year, this watch has really grown on me. I am enjoying it more today than I did when I first got it...which I believe is a testament to the seemingly obsessive workmanship that goes into its production.

I've wanted this watch ever since they came out with it.  Found out they were discontinuing the model and decided to pull the trigger.  No charge (Prime member), next day delivery from Amazon with the specific model and size I ordered.  Ordered directly from Amazon as oppose to a 3rd party vendor because I was concerned about fakes/replica's.  Took it to the Omega store when I received it to get the bracelet sized and they ran the serial number to confirm authenticity.  Watch came with everything except the warranty card from Omega.  In its place was a two year warranty pamphlet through Amazon.  Hopefully I won't have to use it.  Great watch, great service and competitive pricing from Amazon.

Just got this over the weekend. Looks very majestic, feels great to wear. Looks way better in hand than what the picture at the Amazon site shows. The dial is more Platinum-silver in color than what looks like pure white in the picture at site. The watch gives an impression of aristocracy and fine craftsmanship. How it performs over long period is something to be seen. I'll post updates here later. There are are a lot of sites that sells this watch. But buyers beware as internet is washed with counterfeits. I bought it from Amazon because I trust Amazon. So should you.

07/02/15: Update - I've been wearing this watch all these months. Still looks as elegant and great as did when it was brand new out of the box. I don't wear it all the time but at least for 3 days a week, to match with rest of my outfit. I use other watches on other days. Here are few observations to share. When it was brand new out of the box, the leather strap was very stiff to wrap around the wrist. It took quite a bit of wearing to get the strap to conform to my wrist shape. While on that topic, because the watch's leather strap is traditional buckle type, you need to be careful when wearing it or taking it off, as it might slip off and fall to the ground. I dropped it twice that way but luckily, it fell on carpet and the watch didn't sustain any damage or scratch from that. You don't want any damage to happen to such a fine, expensive timepiece. Also, I suggest you invest in a good watch winder to keep it on motion when you are not wearing for few days or so. I use the Brookstone's winder. Very quiet machine. Another thing I have noticed that it gains a minute or so every 30 days. This is not unusual for automatic watches. I have another Tissot automatic watch and that gains about 2 minutes every few weeks to a month or so. Bottom line, this is a beautiful piece of jewelry for a man to own and wear.  Two thumbs up from me.
less than 1 year?the button is out of order

Didn't buy from Amazon, but purchased this exact watch 2 years ago.  2 months after getting it started losing time.  Sent it back and.$60 shipping later it was fixed for free.  Figured ok, stuff happens, bur now its good.  A year later stopped keeping time again.  Sent watch back again.  This time they said the mechanism needs lubed, and instead of free it now cost me $760 for the repair on top of the $30 to ship it to RW in NYC.  Will never waste this money on a RW again.  Just ridiculous

reviews.review_body: I bought this watch because of the bombproof screw down crown, which lasted just about six months before it broke.

Solid watch! Has already taken a beating and it still looks good. It's a little bigger than I expected based on the picture, but I think I prefer it that way. Keeps excellent time (although the second hand doesn't match up with the hash marks), band is sturdy and the face is awesome. It's my everyday watch, and the cool thing is you can easily switch out the bands to dress it up if needed.
I use this watch more than my Hamilton Khaki for now.
This watch is perfect. Rugged. Classy and charming. Really happy with it.

This is a no nonsense field watch. It looks good and is easy to read. The hands and hour markers glow brightly enough to read easily in the dark and the glow lasts all night. There aren't any superfluous bells & whistles to get in the way of its main function, telling time. The titanium case is surprisingly light and the nylon band is comfortable. So far its been keeping perfect time. I'm pleased with my purchase.
